subject: Explicitly set locales to C in LVM driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 14:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/test_lvm.py', 'manila/share/drivers/lvm.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/faaf37f6e24a3c932bdcf8cfd6b38987fe29c6f2', 'message': "Explicitly set locales to C in LVM driver

An output of shell commands is processed in some methods
of LVM driver. If the server uses non-standard locales
it's possible that the output contains unexpected characters
and parsing of the output fails.

Setting LANG=C and LC_ALL=C assures that unexpected characters
are not present. Locals are set in LVM driver methods, an
alternative would be setting them in the 'execute'
wrapper method in manila/utils.py but there is a potential
risk of side effects in case some other driver doesn't want them
set.

Closes-Bug: 1589928
Change-Id: If4428eda6342f9f8fb659999e226d837f2fd63a5
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set locales to C in LVM driver

An output of shell commands is processed in some methods
of LVM driver. If the server uses non-standard locales
it's possible that the output contains unexpected characters
and parsing of the output fails.

Setting LANG=C and LC_ALL=C assures that unexpected characters
are not present. Locals are set in LVM driver methods, an
alternative would be setting them in the 'execute'
wrapper method in manila/utils.py but there is a potential
risk of side effects in case some other driver doesn't want them
set.

Closes-Bug: 1589928
Change-Id: If4428eda6342f9f8fb659999e226d837f2fd63a5

commit_message:
[Devstack] Fix DHSS=False setup for Generic driver

Recent change to devstack [1] broke our DHSS=False CI job running
generic driver that was depending on ip route from host to
private network. So, to avoid this error use floating ip address
for connection to service Nova VMs from host machine.
Also, fix generation of second export location that should be dedicated
for service needs such as mounting share doing host-assisted
migration.

[1] If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f

Change-Id: Ieea992293ae02898741c939da15f0dbb4609d8b0
Closes-Bug: #1644523
Closes-Bug: #1646097

commit_message:
Allow Monasca driver to process enabled nodes only

Compute nodes might be disabled or set to maintenance mode, so
freezer-dr needs to process only enabled nodes to avoid any
problems.

Change-Id: I7a367516008ff7653126621f0761506356d41f05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-dr refs/changes/42/409742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Compute nodes might be disabled or set to maintenance mode so # freezer-dr needs to process only enabled nodes ... self.nodes = [node for node in self.get_compute_nodes() if node['status'] == "enabled"]

commit_message:
Add /etc/environment to systemd unit

To use default environment variable such as HTTP,HTTPS and NO proxy
This fix the curling of etcd.discovery.io failing when initiated by
magnum-conductor

Closes-Bug: #1648530
Change-Id: Iaed5d7446f50874e265b7e62a5ac9935ec815e52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum refs/changes/88/408688/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnvironmentFile=/etc/environment

commit_message:
Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list

The RHEL registration environment file doesn't actually get written to,
so we were passing an environment file with empty values that would
override any values passed on the command line. This removes that file
from the returned list of templates, allowing the passed-in values to
take over.

Change-Id: I0c14e279842d6e9c8ed540cb7605965b39a49eca
Closes-Bug: #1648238
(cherry picked from commit e46cd7d0f3bacc9d2878e0319bf746d3bf182034)

commit_message:
Fix and cleanup rally non-voting jobs

We have a global regex that made all 'gate-rally-dsvm-rally-.*' jobs
non-voting. This now made the job gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial
non-voting as well, something that does not seem to have been the
intention of change I373327609709ad7322e8f0aea9b7f7395e45bd19,
since the job was voting before and in both check and gate queue.

Instead of a non-voting regex, add {suffix} to the
gate-rally-dsvm-rally-{service} jobs and use -nv for them. This has the
side effect of making gate-rally-dsvm-rally-ubuntu-xenial voting again.

Change jobs gate-rally-dsvm-verify in similar way - add suffix and use
-nv as appropriate.

Change-Id: I5b63ae6752231447a9c33c4c822b16c07c525d6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/69/409469/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: 'gate-rally-dsvm-rally-{service}{suffix}'

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary package installs

Xenial PIP installs do not need all of the extra packages laid
down on the host for SNI support like Trusty did.

Change-Id: Ia3fe82b78ef06d8b8d90eb5071bf0e284dba38b9

deleted_lines: pip_required_pip_packages: - ndg-httpsclient # SSL SNI support - requests # SSL SNI support

commit_message:
devstack: add vnc listen address

Make virtual machine graphical console listen on 0.0.0.0.
This allows to access to VM VNC console from remote ('desktop' PC)
on devstack's HOST_IP.
VNC port may be found by using: virsh vncdisplay {vm_name}

Change-Id: I253899393c98c24d46710aa4ab78f1090bae00f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/46/409046/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <graphics type='vnc' port='-1' autoport='yes' listen='0.0.0.0'/>

commit_message:
Add vswitch module to librarian managed list

Plus the following related changes:
  - resource dependence order changed,
  - outdated template cleaned out,
  - passing pmd core param mended.

Change-Id: I86aea3e77967b466fbf256fcdf7187d7b61e6335
Closes-Bug: #1647752

commit_message:
Add root-marker for guides

For stable branches, we need to add root-marker for each manual - and
not the one on top. Add these.

Change-Id: I1eb665be65cd7a64c4bf6cc4e39af887b2c41e47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/13/409713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This marker is needed for infra publishing. # Note for stable branches, this needs to be the top of each manual. MARKER_TEXT="Project: $ZUUL_PROJECT Ref: $ZUUL_REFNAME Build: $ZUUL_UUID Revision: $ZUUL_NEWREV" echo $MARKER_TEXT > publish-docs/newton/$guide/.root-marker
deleted_lines: # This marker is needed for infra publishing. # Note for stable branches, this needs to be the top of each manual. MARKER_TEXT="Project: $ZUUL_PROJECT Ref: $ZUUL_REFNAME Build: $ZUUL_UUID Revision: $ZUUL_NEWREV" echo $MARKER_TEXT > publish-docs/.root-marker

commit_message:
Replace local storage of domain UUIDs with leader storage

Currently the Keystone leader charm creates new domains and stores
the UUIDs locally on disk. This approach predates charm relation-/
leader- storage, is error prone, and causes problems in HA setups.

Move to leader storage and remove old interfaces. There is no need
to migrate the on-disk stored data as it is read from the deployment
and stored as a part of the upgrade process.

Do not set default values for service_tenant_id, admin_domain_id and
default_domain_id. This will cause context to be incomplete on peer
units until the values are actually available.

Change functional tests to run on Keystone cluster to verify contents of
configuration and operation of services in clustered environment.

Closes-Bug: 1637453
Change-Id: Id0eaf7bfceead627cc691e9b52dd889d60c05fa9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone refs/changes/01/403601/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PUBLIC, ADMIN, PKI_CERTS_DIR, ensure_pki_cert_paths, ADMIN_DOMAIN, leader_get(attribute='admin_domain_id') or 'admin_domain_id') leader_get(attribute='default_domain_id') or 'default')
deleted_lines: PUBLIC, ADMIN, PKI_CERTS_DIR, ensure_pki_cert_paths, get_admin_domain_id, get_default_domain_id, ADMIN_DOMAIN, get_admin_domain_id() or 'admin_domain_id') get_default_domain_id() or 'default')

commit_message:
Namespace handler

This patch adds NamespaceHandler that tracks creation and removal of
Kubernetes namespaces and adds or removes a list of configurable
resources' paths to the watcher.

Change-Id: I351b9e8ad629f997cc39c27c49e5645be29c7f22
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/29/391329/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from kuryr_kubernetes import config from kuryr_kubernetes import constants from kuryr_kubernetes.handlers import k8s_base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class NamespaceHandler(k8s_base.ResourceEventHandler): """Handles Kubernetes namespace events. `NamespaceHandler` tracks creation and removal of Kubernetes namespaces and adds or removes a list of configurable `resources_to_watch` paths to the `watcher`. """ OBJECT_KIND = constants.K8S_OBJ_NAMESPACE def __init__(self, watcher): self._watcher = watcher self._resources = config.CONF.kubernetes.resources_to_watch def on_present(self, event): for resource in self._resources: path = "%s/%s/%s" % (constants.K8S_API_NAMESPACES, k8s_base.object_name(event), resource) self._watcher.add(path) def on_deleted(self, event): for resource in self._resources: path = "%s/%s/%s" % (constants.K8S_API_NAMESPACES, k8s_base.object_name(event), resource) self._watcher.remove(path)

commit_message:
Pin docutils version

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build docs
with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version matches
the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: Ie82b943299a89d99aa70f3cc7139ecbb19b4b593

Change-Id: I171d079b95e1ae3ea70f49532e98d4ec97c22122

commit_message:
[WIP] K8s event processing

Change-Id: I171d079b95e1ae3ea70f49532e98d4ec97c22122
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/05/369105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Event Processing ================ TODO: summary Events as state --------------- Depending on when the event occured the same environment state can be observed as both ADDED or MODIFIED event. Also the event body contains the observed state of the object for all the events and for the MODIFIED event there is no way to determine the changes based on the event itself. TODO: maybe some better reasoning Thus the events will be considered as state declarations and MODIFIED event should be processed the same way as ADDED event. Another option would be to ignore the MODIFIED events (which could also improve performance), but that would limit functionality where the object has to transition through multiple states. Declarative event handlers -------------------------- From the perspective of the event handler one has to distinguish the observed state (event body), the desired state and the actual state of the environment. E.g. for the Pod ADDED/MODIFIED event the desired state is to have a corresponding Neutron port present and the Pod to have an annotation containing that port information. The event body however could be missing the port information while the neutron port could actually be present (e.g. created concurrently or if the Kuryr server crashed between creating the port and updating the annotation). The event handlers will be implemented to ensure the desired state considering the actual state (e.g. if the port annotation is missing only create the port unless it has already been created) and to also validating the observed state (e.g. if the port annotation is present in the observed state, but the port is for some reason missing). Composable event handlers ------------------------- TODO: describe how handlers for different object types are separated (e.g. Port and Annotation) while also allowing interactions Event concurrency within single node ------------------------------------ While the event streams for each K8s 'watch' endpoint are sequential, there are several options on how to handle the events: a) Handle the events in the 'thread' of the event stream. This option simplifies the concurrency but is considered undesireable due to performance/scalability limitations. b) Handle all events asynchronously by dispatching them to the workers pool. This option is an improvement on performance/scalability issues of option (a). It, however, also introduces concurrency issues as it allows for conflicting states of the same object to be processed at the same time (which could lead to non-deterministic results) or the same state (from the Kuryr point of view, e.g. MODIFIED event with changed labels or non-Kuryr annotations) being processed multiple times imposing unnecessary load on e.g. Neutron. c) Group events based on the object and process them serially within the group but concurrently across the groups. This option provides simplified concurrency model of option (a) while also ensuring good performance/scalability of option (b) and also makes it possible to avoid duplicate events. The implementation will follow option (c). Whenever an event is observed an event key will be computed based on the object body (e.g. type and id). For that key a Worker object will be created (or selected for subsequent events) and the event will be passed to the Worker. As soon as the Worker has no events to process it will enter grace period (optionaly infinite) to wait for more events and will then stop (by removing itself from the parent object) if no events occured during the grace period. Also the implementation will make sure the dispatch/scheduling mechanism is pluggable (i.e. single-threaded for CNI driver). Event concurrency across the nodes ---------------------------------- TODO: detailed explanation; in short: - moving neutron port interactions to CNI should solve all problems with Port, and LBaaS is probably non-issue as IP is unique for LB and Members; but will hammer Neutron uncontrollably and will require Neutron auth for CNI (tho not much different from K8s auth that CNI requires anyway) - locking is not an option (or a very undesired one) - due to the declarative nature of event handlers should be possible to run multiple instances, but no 100% guarantee - events for the same object (or, more specifically, object group for Service/Endpoints) should not be processed on different nodes concurrently - nodes coordinate group membership; each node has own serial number "SN" and knows the grop size "N" - each event will pass a filter based on "SN" and "N" values (e.g. mod (object-key, N) == SN) - filtered events are buffered or served from cache, no state mutations are allowed (i.e. no calls to Neutron/K8s for filtered events; even for 'get') - on cluster group membership change SN/N are recomputed and buffered events are processed (and also filtered based on new SN/N) - decision for split-brain: either process all events and rely on handlers being declarative or drop events - another compelling option would be to recreate the watcher on membership change; pros: kiss, cons: tbd if any Event context ------------- TODO: describe "actual-state" caching (and how it addresses dependencies and duplicate events) Event dependencies ------------------ TODO: describe Service and Endpoints interactions and IncompleteState exception/postponing events Transactional context and rollbacks ----------------------------------- TODO: detailed explanation; example: port created but annotation failed (e.g. Pod got destroyed while processing event) -> port should be removed Lost DELETED events and orphans ------------------------------- TODO Implementation details/examples(?) ---------------------------------- TODO: CNI driver as watcher with single-threaded Scheduler Things to consider ------------------ TODO: batching requests to neutron (get/list; could be an issue on startup/restart for large deployments)

subject: Replace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 07:07:58.000000000', 'files': ['integration/tests/integration/tests/volumes/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/d7eb346f0bc3aa31f4bfbadbe9e7c545c9cc1a0b', 'message': "Replace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

1. What is the problem?
Function assertNotEqual(None. ...) is still used in file driver.py.
OpenStack Style Guidelines suggest to use assertIs(Not)None to check for
None Unit test assertions, as assertIs(Not)None tends to give better
messages for more specific assertions. More info, see:

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Rplace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I060639600616322cf0e0698228fa22073a2bf29b
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

1. What is the problem?
Function assertNotEqual(None. ...) is still used in file driver.py.
OpenStack Style Guidelines suggest to use assertIs(Not)None to check for
None Unit test assertions, as assertIs(Not)None tends to give better
messages for more specific assertions. More info, see:

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Rplace 'assertNotEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNotNone(...)'

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: I060639600616322cf0e0698228fa22073a2bf29b

commit_message:
Fix implementation of docker profile deletion

The profile deletion of docker should override the base class's 'delete'
method to provide additional logic needed for breaking dependency. We
are not supposed to do adhoc specialization in the engine code.

Change-Id: I79c75f4e91b59637995ee338c56a94bea27a28fd

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is now ready to use constraints everywhere, adapt
the venv environment to use the default install command instead of a
specific non-constrainted install command.

With this change, now all tox environments use constraints.

Change-Id: Ibb73b4a27b5b0462a9e9f2dd80e437bcc8c7f8f4

commit_message:
Handle ImageNotFound exception during instance backup

If user have already backed up instance to few numbers and then
execute backup api with rotation 1, then nova will delete the
previously created images exceeding rotation limit.
During deleting these images, if user mistakenly deletes one of the
image in advance, then backup instance won't be able to delete all
images exceeding rotation limit causing api failure.

This patch handles ImageNotFound exception during deleting backup
images, logs a warning message and continues deleting all of the
remaining images.

Closes-Bug: #1634773
Change-Id: Ib999138ddbbcd62e0c99a69e5c6d37b4e49f871f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/388519/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self.image_api.delete(context, image_id) except exception.ImageNotFound: LOG.warning(_LW("Failed to find image %(image_id)s to " "delete"), {'image_id': image_id}, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Add primary task for network-server-config

Sometimes task network-server-config on non-primary-controller
executes before primary-controller. We should specify the start order

Change-Id: I0288d84b64c061a079c471fe47b2bc312a3f5659
Closes-Bug: #1646799

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix initialising of LVM ephemeral disks

The LVM backend expects to write directly to the target disk rather
than to the image cache when initialising an ephemeral disk. This is
confounded by Image.cache(), which doesn't call the given callback
(_create_ephemeral in this case), if the target already exists.

Closes-Bug: #1648109
Co-authored-by: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic9178d6c013670611e63d54a7669f35dc9770e91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/408152/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.synchronized(filename, external=True, lock_path=self.lock_path) def fetch_func_sync(target, *args, **kwargs): # NOTE(mdbooth): This method is called as a callback by the # create_image() method of a specific backend. It assumes that # target will be in the image cache, which is why it holds a # lock, and does not overwrite an existing file. However, # this is not true for all backends. Specifically Lvm writes # directly to the target rather than to the image cache, # and additionally it creates the target in advance. # This guard is only relevant in the context of the lock if the # target is in the image cache. If it isn't, we should # call fetch_func. The lock we're holding is also unnecessary in # that case, but it will not result in incorrect behaviour. if target != base or not os.path.exists(target): fetch_func(target=target, *args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: @utils.synchronized(filename, external=True, lock_path=self.lock_path) def fetch_func_sync(target, *args, **kwargs): # The image may have been fetched while a subsequent # call was waiting to obtain the lock. if not os.path.exists(target): fetch_func(target=target, *args, **kwargs)

subject: Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 20:24:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f152cbd644507d6a195380f1a6cbbfc0925a3008', 'message': "WIP: Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

commit_message:
Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

Closes-Bug: #1648840
Change-Id: Iab5afdf1b5b8d107ea0e5895c24d50712e7dc7b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/408806/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Guestfs handle no passwd or group in image

When setting ownership of a file or directory, the guestfs driver
looks for the /etc/passwd and/or /etc/group files. In case they
are not found, the current driver lets the auges RuntimeError
through, which does not produce a very helpful error message.
Fixing that by handling the original exception and rasing a
Nova exception with more details in it.

Related-bug: #1646002

Change-Id: I2d15865c8be13b938e10e67c1b1b160f2a80f0c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/407037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

(%(e)s)") % \ {'path': path, 'user': user, 'e': e} raise exception.NovaException(msg) if group is not None: try: gid = int(self.handle.aug_get( "/files/etc/group/" + group + "/gid")) except RuntimeError as e: msg = _("Error setting ownership of path %(path)s to group" " %(group)s - could not read the uid. (%(e)s)") % \ {'path': path, 'group': group, 'e': e} raise exception.NovaException(msg)
deleted_lines: uid = int(self.handle.aug_get( "/files/etc/passwd/" + user + "/uid")) if group is not None: gid = int(self.handle.aug_get( "/files/etc/group/" + group + "/gid"))

commit_message:
Fix command examples in networking docs

All create commands now need to specify a name for the object to be
created, add this to the "subnet create" examples.

Also, the support for setting the external gateway for a router is still
under review [1], revert to using the old version until the new one is
released.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/357973

Change-Id: Ic97733897d4c158bc4432f861e654a47fef6df60
Closes-Bug: 1648764
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/87/409087/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack subnet create --network public --subnet-range 172.16.1.0/24 public-subnet $ openstack subnet create --network net1 --subnet-range 10.0.0.0/24 subnet1 $ openstack subnet create --network net2 --subnet-range 10.0.1.0/24 subnet2 $ neutron router-gateway-set router1 EXT_NET_ID
deleted_lines: $ openstack subnet create --network public --subnet-range 172.16.1.0/24 $ openstack subnet create --network net1 --subnet-range 10.0.0.0/24 $ openstack subnet create --network net2 --subnet-range 10.0.1.0/24 $ openstack router set --external-gateway EXT_NET_ID router1

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is ready to use constraints everywhere, adapt
the venv environment to use the default install command instead of a
specific non-constrainted install command.

See also:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

Change-Id: I5b68c9391e80131d7454812280123b72b6ac482a

commit_message:
Workaround is required to prevent deadlock in task serializers.

Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed
to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in
deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but
upstream repositories have much older version.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051

Change-Id: I0676de8f74cf4e0d248e0a074b58960bf86b7fbd
(cherry picked from commit 6068002263e9dd3cc730821039b9f315b1a5b150)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/18/400918/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _serialize_task_for_node_in_worker(node_and_task_and_err): node_and_task, err = node_and_task_and_err # NOTE(el): See comment for `wrap_task_iter` method. if err: raise err def wrap_task_iter(iterator): """Workaround is required to prevent deadlock. Due to a bug in core python library [1], if iterator passed to imap or imap_unordered raises an exception, it hangs in deadlock forever, the issue is fixed in python 2.7.10, but upstream repositories have much older version. [1] http://bugs.python.org/issue23051 """ try: for i in iterator: yield i, None except Exception as e: yield (None, None), e _serialize_task_for_node_in_worker, wrap_task_iter(tasks)

commit_message:
Add Xenial support for MariaDB

Add the elements for building the MariaDB 10.1 guest image on Xenial.

A change was required to the service_candidates to allow for the
selection of the systemd unit file (mariadb.service) instead of the
old upstart script.

Change-Id: Iee0548e109f26c675b1410b6457b9e63ada9c0db

commit_message:
Enable heat plugin in senlin gate job

This patch enables heat plugin in senlin gate job.
Otherwise, heat service won't be setup during devstack
installation.

Change-Id: I1ddac196ae4abfcc1fcb99a443213cc319225ab6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/43/409043/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add FreeIPA enrollment template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 10:25:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ad08fc87a9b3a793f763b12459bd3bedf1976f7f', 'message': "Add FreeIPA enrollment script and tool

This is based on previous work [1] and it's what I've been using to
test the TLS-everywhere work.

This introduces a template that will run on every node to enroll
them to FreeIPA and acquire a ticket (authenticate) in order to be
able to request certificates.

Enrollment is done via the ipa-client-install command and it does
the following:

* Get FreeIPA's CA certificate and trust it.
* Authenticate to FreeIPA using an OTP and get a kerberos keytab.
* Set up several configurations that are needed for FreeIPA (sssd,
  kerberos, certmonger)

The keytab is then used to authenticate and get an actual TGT
(Ticket-Granting-Ticket) from Kerberos

The previous implementation used a PreConfig hook, however, here it
was modified to use NodeTLSCAData. This has the advantage that it
runs on every node as opposed to the PreConfig hook where we had to
specify the role type so it's a usability improvement. And, on the
other hand, this does set up necessary things for the usage of
FreeIPA as a CA, such as getting the certificate and enrolling to the
CA.

This also includes a convenience tool that will generate an
environment file that sets the override in the resource registry as
well as setting relevant parameters that will be needed in a
TLS-everywhere deployment.

[1] https://github.com/JAORMX/freeipa-tripleo-incubator

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Iac94b3b047dca1bcabd464ea8eed6f1220c844f1

commit_message:
Add FreeIPA enrollment template

This is based on previous work [1] and it's what I've been using to
test the TLS-everywhere work.

This introduces a template that will run on every node to enroll
them to FreeIPA and acquire a ticket (authenticate) in order to be
able to request certificates.

Enrollment is done via the ipa-client-install command and it does
the following:

* Get FreeIPA's CA certificate and trust it.
* Authenticate to FreeIPA using an OTP and get a kerberos keytab.
* Set up several configurations that are needed for FreeIPA (sssd,
  kerberos, certmonger)

The keytab is then used to authenticate and get an actual TGT
(Ticket-Granting-Ticket) from Kerberos

The previous implementation used a PreConfig hook, however, here it
was modified to use NodeTLSCAData. This has the advantage that it
runs on every node as opposed to the PreConfig hook where we had to
specify the role type so it's a usability improvement. And, on the
other hand, this does set up necessary things for the usage of
FreeIPA as a CA, such as getting the certificate and enrolling to the
CA.

[1] https://github.com/JAORMX/freeipa-tripleo-incubator

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: Iac94b3b047dca1bcabd464ea8eed6f1220c844f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/99/407999/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python """ Generate an environment file to enroll the controller nodes to FreeIPA via the ExtraConfigPre hook. Please note that this is only used for testing. """ from __future__ import print_function import argparse import collections import logging import os import yaml logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) autogen_warning = """### DO NOT MODIFY THIS FILE ### created by the script create_freeipa_enroll_envfile.py """ TEMPLATE_DEFAULT_PATH = 'puppet/extraconfig/tls/freeipa-enroll.yaml' class TemplateDumper(yaml.SafeDumper): def represent_ordered_dict(self, data): return self.represent_dict(data.items()) TemplateDumper.add_representer(collections.OrderedDict, TemplateDumper.represent_ordered_dict) def write_env_file(output_file, env_dict): with open(output_file, 'w') as f: f.write(autogen_warning) yaml.dump(env_dict, f, TemplateDumper, width=68, default_flow_style=False) LOG.info("environment file written to %s" % os.path.abspath(output_file)) def get_freeipa_parameter_defaults_dict(password, server, domain, dns_servers, ipa_ip): parameter_defaults = { 'FreeIPAOTP': password, 'FreeIPAServer': server, 'CloudDomain': domain, } if dns_servers: parameter_defaults['DnsServers'] = dns_servers if ipa_ip: parameter_defaults['FreeIPAIPAddress'] = ipa_ip return parameter_defaults def get_freeipa_resource_registry_dict(stack): if not stack: filename = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), '../', TEMPLATE_DEFAULT_PATH) resource_registry = { 'OS::TripleO::NodeTLSCAData': os.path.abspath(filename) } return resource_registry def _form_fqdn(name, domain): return "%s.%s" % (name, domain) def get_cloud_names_parameter_defaults_dict(cloud_name, cloud_name_internal, cloud_name_storage, cloud_name_storage_management, cloud_name_ctlplane, cloud_domain): return { 'CloudName': _form_fqdn(cloud_name, cloud_domain), 'CloudNameInternal': _form_fqdn(cloud_name_internal, cloud_domain), 'CloudNameStorage': _form_fqdn(cloud_name_storage, cloud_domain), 'CloudNameStorageManagement': _form_fqdn(cloud_name_storage_management, cloud_domain), 'CloudNameCtlplane': _form_fqdn(cloud_name_ctlplane, cloud_domain), } def get_freeipa_environment_dict(password, server, domain, dns_servers, ipa_ip, stack, cloud_name, cloud_name_internal, cloud_name_storage, cloud_name_storage_management, cloud_name_ctlplane): enroll_dict = get_freeipa_parameter_defaults_dict(password, server, domain, dns_servers, ipa_ip) names_dict = get_cloud_names_parameter_defaults_dict(cloud_name, cloud_name_internal, cloud_name_storage, cloud_name_storage_management, cloud_name_ctlplane, domain) enroll_dict.update(names_dict) return get_environment_dict(enroll_dict, get_freeipa_resource_registry_dict(stack)) def get_environment_dict(parameter_defaults=None, resource_registry=None): resulting_dict = collections.OrderedDict() if parameter_defaults: resulting_dict['parameter_defaults'] = parameter_defaults if resource_registry: resulting_dict['resource_registry'] = resource_registry return resulting_dict def _confirm(message): user_input = raw_input(message) return user_input.lower() in ['true', '1', 't', 'y', 'yes'] def _confirmation_if_output_file_exists(output, overwrite): if os.path.isfile(output) and not overwrite: LOG.warning("%s exists in the filesystem." % output) if not _confirm("Do you want to overwrite it? "): raise RuntimeError("%s exists and won't be overwritten." % output) def _assert_stack_file_exists(stack): if not os.path.isfile(stack): raise IOError("%s file doesn't exist." % args.stack) def _assert_not_empty(server, domain): if not server or not domain: raise RuntimeError( "FreeIPA's server and the domain name can't be empty") def _warn_unmatching_domain(server, domain): if not server.endswith(domain): LOG.warning(("FreeIPA's server domain doesn't seem to match the given " "domain %s ... watch out") % domain) def _validate_input(args): _confirmation_if_output_file_exists(args.output, args.overwrite) if args.stack: _assert_stack_file_exists(args.stack) _assert_not_empty(args.server, args.domain) _warn_unmatching_domain(args.server, args.domain) def _get_options(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description=__doc__) # Base stack arguments parser.add_argument('-w', '--password', required=True, help='The OTP that will be used for the nodes.') parser.add_argument('-s', '--server', required=True, help="The FreeIPA server's fqdn.") parser.add_argument('-d', '--domain', required=True, help=("The FreeIPA managed domain (must match the " "kerberos realm.")) parser.add_argument('-D', '--dns-server', action='append', help=("The DNS server(s) that the overcloud should " "have configured.")) parser.add_argument('-i', '--ipa-ip', help="The FreeIPA server's IP address.") parser.add_argument('-S', '--stack', default=None, help=("stack template that will be used if not " "default.")) parser.add_argument('-o', '--output', default='freeipa-enroll.yaml', help=('file that the freeipa-related environment will ' 'be written to.')) # Cloud name environment arguments parser.add_argument('--cloud-name', default='overcloud', help=("The shortname for the overcloud (the domain " "will be appended to this).")) parser.add_argument('--cloud-name-internal', default='overcloud.internalapi', help=("The shortname name of the overcloud's internal " "API endpoint (the domain will be appended to " "this).")) parser.add_argument('--cloud-name-storage', default='overcloud.storage', help=("The shortname name of the overcloud's storage " "endpoint (the domain will be appended to " "this).")) parser.add_argument('--cloud-name-storage-management', default='overcloud.storagemgmt', help=("The shortname name of the overcloud's storage " " management endpoint (the domain will be " "appended to this).")) parser.add_argument('--cloud-name-ctlplane', default='overcloud.ctlplane', help=("The shortname name of the overcloud's " "ctlplane endpoint (the domain will be " "appended to this).")) # Extra parser.add_argument('--overwrite', action='store_true', help='overwrite the output file if it already exists.') return parser.parse_args() def main(): args = _get_options() _validate_input(args) enroll_dict = get_freeipa_environment_dict( args.password, args.server, args.domain, args.dns_server, args.ipa_ip, args.stack, args.cloud_name, args.cloud_name_internal, args.cloud_name_storage, args.cloud_name_storage_management, args.cloud_name_ctlplane) write_env_file(args.output, enroll_dict) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for percona xtradb cluster

percona xtradb cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'WSREP detected deadlock/conflict and aborted the transaction.
         Try restarting the transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Closes-Bug: #1648818

Change-Id: Ic43cb0e0946506a4b7ce9f94ee9eba5e025ed3d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/94/409194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactoring current upgrade scripts for composable upgrades

This submission splits the different upgrades steps into
the Ansible upgrade tasks.

Note: WIP

The next step will be to move this to use
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403397/
and use the Ansible modules to handle the
pacemaker cluster.

Change-Id: I4ff4227ec2b7f11641e6ea630ed2a243993e1fc2

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/485b8b8a5bb81d52022bf17de791d974

Change-Id: I499ca8ce07c491c3aa9c7814a7e07f6637231fb3

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-12-10 09:23+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-12-11 10:59+0000\n"msgid "" "All nodes require Internet access for administrative purposes such as " "package installation, security updates, :term:`DNS <Domain Name System " "(DNS)>`, and :term:`NTP <Network Time Protocol (NTP)>`. In most cases, nodes " "should obtain internet access through the management network interface. To " "highlight the importance of network separation, the example architectures " "use `private address space <https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1918>`__ for the " "management network and assume that the physical network infrastructure " "provides Internet access via :term:`NAT <Network Address Translation (NAT)>` " "or other method. The example architectures use routable IP address space for " "the provider (external) network and assume that the physical network " "infrastructure provides direct Internet access." msgstr "" "Tous les nuds ncessitent un accs Internet pour des besoins administratifs " "comme l'installation de packages, de mises  jour de scurit, le :term:`DNS " "<Domain Name System (DNS)>` et le :term:`NTP <Network Time Protocol (NTP)>`. " "Dans la plupart des cas, les nuds doivent avoir accs  Internet via " "l'interface rseau de management. You must reconfigure LVM to scan only the devices that " "contain the ``cinder-volumes`` volume group. Vous devez " "reconfigurer LVM pour analyser seulement les devices qui contiennent le " "groupe de volumes``cinder-volumes``. ditez le fichier ``/etc/lvm/lvm.conf`` " "et effectuez les oprations suivantes : " "Replace ``ADMIN_PASS`` with a suitable password for an administrative user." msgstr "" "Remplacer ``ADMIN_PASS`` par un mot de passe appropri pour un " "administrateur." msgid ""msgid "" "Replace ``NEUTRON_PASS`` with the password you chose for the ``neutron`` " "user in the Identity service." msgstr "" "Remplacer ``NEUTRON_PASS`` par le mot de passe choisi pour l'utilisateur " "``neutron`` dans le service d'Identit." "account in RabbitMQ." msgstr "" "Remplacer ``RABBIT_PASS`` par le mot de passe choisi pour le compte " "``openstack`` dans RabbitMQ." msgid "" "Replace ``RABBIT_PASS`` with the password you chose for the ``openstack`` "msgid "Restart the Apache service and remove the default SQLite database:" msgstr "" "Redmarrer le service Apache et supprimer la base de donnes SQLite par " "dfaut." msgid "The Debian package will perform the below operations for you:" msgstr "" "Le package Debian va alors raliser les oprations suivantes pour vous:" msgid "" "The Linux bridge agent builds layer-2 (bridging and switching) virtual " "networking infrastructure for instances and handles security groups." msgstr "" "L'agent Linux bridge construit l'infrastructure de rseau virtuel layer-2 " "(bridging and switching) pour les instances et gre les groupes de scurit." commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifaa862be3e7b4457bba066405c73a657250a7b7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/93/401293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key, value in dic.items(): for k, v in expected_subset.items(): for k, v in kw.items():
deleted_lines: import six for key, value in six.iteritems(dic): for k, v in six.iteritems(expected_subset): for k, v in six.iteritems(kw):

commit_message:
Real-time compute nodes

A spec that proposes changes to support deployment of compute node for latency
sensitive real-time applications.

Change-Id: I9ffb77455a220d0e6e775c56f84358c2e9371809
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/62/388162/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Add real-time compute nodes to TripleO ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/tripleo-realtime Real-time guest VMs require compute nodes with a specific configuration to control the sources of latency spikes. Problem Description =================== Manual configuration of compute nodes to support real-time guests is possible. However this is complex and time consuming where there is large number of compute nodes to configure. On a real-time compute node a subset of the available physical CPUs (pCPUs) are isolated and dedicated to real-time tasks. The remaining pCPUs are dedicated to general housekeeping tasks. This requires a non-standard Linux Kernel and KVM modules that allow their housekeeping tasks to be isolated. Huge pages are also reserved for guest VMs to prevent page faults. A real-time guest is partitioned in a similar manner, having one or more real-time virtual CPUs (vCPUs) and one or more general vCPUs to handle the non-realtime housekeeping tasks. A real-time vCPU is pinned to a real-time pCPU while a housekeeping vCPU is pinned to a housekeeping pCPUS. The real-time and housekeeping pCPUs typically reside on different NUMA nodes. Use Cases --------- The primary use-case is NFV appliances deployed by the telco community which require strict latency guarantees. Other latency sensitive applications should also benefit. Proposed Change =============== This spec proposes changes to automate the deployment of real-time capable compute nodes using TripleO. * the overcloud image for the real-time compute nodes shall include: * real-time Linux Kernel * real-time KVM modules * real-time tuned profiles * huge pages shall be enabled on the compute nodes. * huge pages shall be reserved for the real-time guests. * CPU pinning shall be used to isolate kernel housekeeping tasks from the real-time tasks by configuring tuned. * CPU pinning shall be used to isolate virtualization housekeeping tasks from the real-time tasks by configuring nova. Alternatives ------------ None Security Impact --------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Worse-case latency in real-time guest VMs should be significantly reduced. However a real-time configuration potentially reduces the overall throughput of a compute node. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- The operator will remain responsible for: * appropriate BIOS settings on compute node. * post-deployment configuration * creating/modifying flavors to enable CPU pinning, hugepages, dedicated CPUs, realtime policy Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: owalsh Other contributors: ansiwen Work Items ---------- As outlined in the proposed changes. Dependencies ============ * Libvirt real time instances https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-real-time * Hugepages enabled in the Compute nodes. https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1589929 * CPU isolation of real-time and non-realtime tasks. https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1589930 * Tuned https://fedorahosted.org/tuned/ Testing ======= Genuine real-time guests are unlikely to be testable in CI: * specific BIOS settings are required. * images with real-time Kernel and KVM modules are required However the workflow to deploy these guest should be testable in CI. Documentation Impact ==================== Manual steps performed by the operator shall be documented: * BIOS settings for low latency * Post-deployment configuration * Real-time overcloud image creation References ========== Nova blueprint "Libvirt real time instances" https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-real-time The requirements are similar to :doc:`../newton/tripleo-ovs-dpdk`

commit_message:
Fix mock order

As per [1], the order of the created mocks passed into test function must
matches the decorators apply order(from the bottom upwards).

[1] http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/patch.html#nesting-patch-decorators

Change-Id: I139f78f25c32cf82c9d4b4d4d3a2852a23fab89c

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/442ca38a0b002b59f86621a88d9cd02c

Change-Id: Ibec8a3589d22a58c43e4a62329e4172840422d92

commit_message:
[Devstack] Run tempest update in proper time

Recent devstack change [1] changed order of installing things,
where tempest now is installed later than it was. So, run our
tempest updates later too, when tempest is installed.

Closes-Bug: #1646492

[1] I3d98692e69d94756e0034c83a247e05d85177f02

Change-Id: I85ca94455ad0b7882cde70c6ba0091f9f83f39b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/83/405383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
conf: Remove config option compute_ manager

compute_manager config options were deprecated in
13.0.0, we can remove it now.

Depends-On: I93b62372e357db4f7c39992c244b2ec9e594ad9c

Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: I84503655bd9675ff441073e51059202142db22ab

commit_message:
change the cron-trigger execution time from localtime to UTC

When a cron-trigger is created, in the output, the created time is
shown in UTC but the next execution time is in localtime. It would
be better if both times are shown in the same timezone. This patch
changes the next execution time to UTC.

Change-Id: Icae26cef37736cb55b9a2460f16e82afdb058165
Closes-Bug: #1592164
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/40/406740/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local_time = croniter(pattern, start_time).get_next(datetime.datetime) epoch_second = time.mktime(local_time.timetuple()) utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(epoch_second) return utc_time datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(0, 2) first_second = time.mktime(first_time.timetuple()) first_utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(first_second) sum_time = datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(0, 60) if sum_time > first_utc_time: first_second = time.mktime(first_time.timetuple()) first_utc_time = datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(first_second) next_time = first_utc_time
deleted_lines: return croniter.croniter(pattern, start_time).get_next(datetime.datetime) datetime.datetime.now() + datetime.timedelta(0, 2) if (datetime.datetime.now() + datetime.timedelta(0, 60)) > first_time: next_time = first_time

commit_message:
Fix stable newton dependencies

Changes in upstream neutron broke the stable version. Hence we
needed to do the following:
1. ensure that the upper constraints are set correctly
2. make sure that stable/newton is pulled for newton

Change-Id: I1319408f1bedcaa166e809eafb2fb00e6a1aa051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/67/408967/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = {toxinidir}/tools/tox_install.sh {env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/newton} {opts} {packages} git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron.git@stable/newton#egg=neutronignore = E123,H803,H302,H904,H305,H306,H307

commit_message:
Fix object attributeError when node update

declared method(confirm_service_resize) in Proxy
not match called method(confirm_resize_server) in Node

Closes-bug: #1648285
Change-Id: I6943b0160868c131847c7874e18e5f802689bf2c

commit_message:
Fix docker create class method

This adds an override version of the 'create' class method for docker
container. The purpose is to have the 'create' logic automatically build
a dependency between the profile and the cluster referenced.

Change-Id: Ib0d82575e2049222b5c2335a5576b499e36a50c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/12/407412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove dead code about receiver-notify

This patch removes dead code about receiver-notify including
obsolete service call, unit test cases and rpc call.

Change-Id: I42dcc732dc3a5252e70ee72ec9ffd3fe9e859952
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/98/408998/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_receiver_notify(self, mock_find, mock_load): fake_obj = mock.Mock() fake_obj.id = 'FAKE_ID' fake_obj.type = 'message' fake_obj.user = self.ctx.user fake_receiver = mock.Mock() mock_find.return_value = fake_obj mock_load.return_value = fake_receiver result = self.eng.receiver_notify(self.ctx, 'FAKE_RECEIVER') self.assertIsNone(result) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_RECEIVER') mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, receiver_obj=fake_obj, project_safe=True) fake_receiver.notify.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, None) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'receiver_find') def test_receiver_notify_not_found(self, mock_find): mock_find.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='receiver', id='RR') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_notify, self.ctx, 'Bogus') self.assertEqual(exc.ResourceNotFound, ex.exc_info[0]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'receiver_find') def test_receiver_notify_permission_check_fail(self, mock_find): fake_obj = mock.Mock() fake_obj.id = 'FAKE_ID' fake_obj.user = 'foo' mock_find.return_value = fake_obj ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_notify, self.ctx, 'Bogus') self.assertEqual(exc.Forbidden, ex.exc_info[0]) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'receiver_find') def test_receiver_notify_incorrect_type(self, mock_find): fake_obj = mock.Mock() fake_obj.id = 'FAKE_ID' fake_obj.user = self.ctx.user fake_obj.type = 'not_message' mock_find.return_value = fake_obj ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.receiver_notify, self.ctx, 'Bogus') self.assertEqual(exc.Forbidden, ex.exc_info[0]) @mock.patch.object(rb.Receiver, 'load') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'receiver_find')

commit_message:
Engine support for receiver_notify2

This patch adds engine support for receiver_notify2.

Change-Id: I5a0295ecdd8e2574a018b001b4c4b9bf26df3edc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/91/408991/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

fake_obj.id = 'FAKE_ID' fake_obj.type = 'message' fake_obj.user = self.ctx.user fake_receiver = mock.Mock() mock_find.return_value = fake_obj mock_load.return_value = fake_receiver req = orro.ReceiverNotifyRequest(identity='FAKE_RECEIVER') result = self.eng.receiver_notify2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertIsNone(result) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, commit_message:
Use OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES instead

As we're explicitly enabling services, set
OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES, as setting DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1
enables horizon and hence zaqar plugin expects zaqar-ui project.

Change-Id: Ia666527f807b00233443baa5b314ff30f79a8dc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/05/409605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix sorting of settings

_.sortBy works improperly when returning array as a sorter.
Numbers are sorted as strings in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1644461

Change-Id: I7642ae2af6b847bd7c3217700f6866c2aef307c9

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I0ab1a012ed744eb0be685e87de0270772c16a9c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/90/409590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key, val in items.items():
deleted_lines: import six for key, val in six.iteritems(items):

commit_message:
Free up the experimental queue for neutron

Some jobs are not particularly relevant anymore: we periodically
test neutron-lib master changes against neutron [1] and we are
no longer actively working on vpnaas.

This patch frees up some slots.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-neutron-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/

Change-Id: I3c46adda24b310b7f4d862010b2a4526743a31d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/408846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Is the library actively maintained?
The recent updates were quite some time back, but the code is very stable and
there was no need to update it. https://pypi.python.org/pypi/bunch/1.0.1

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes. The code is python 3 compatible.

Is the library license compatible?
Yes. The license is MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
The library is available for ubuntu at:
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-bunch

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
Not that I could see.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup?
Yes. Required for Cinder.

Yes. Required for Cinder and specifically for the following

Change-Id: I3b890f7bf2187f614298fdcd0b14b03be3ee1737

commit_message:
Add neobunch

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes. Last update was on November 2015.
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/neobunch

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes. The code is python 3 compatible.

Is the library license compatible?
Yes. The license is MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
The older bunch package is available in Ubuntu and Fedora.
Available for ubuntu at:
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-bunch
Available for Fedore at:
https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-bunch
The neobunch is not available for these distros.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?
Not that I could see.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?
Yes. Required for Cinder and specifically for the following
review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404958/

Change-Id: I3b890f7bf2187f614298fdcd0b14b03be3ee1737

commit_message:
Enable Py35-NV jobs for monasca

Following change is meant to enable running python jobs
for Python3.5. Change was inspired by the recent
changes regarding cross-python compatybility and attempts
to make monasca compatible with Python 3.x.

New gates will be non-voting so they won't make new/existing
changes blocked but will allow to detect all incompatibilities
between Python 2.x and Python 3.x

Additionally, added full set of Python CI for monasca-events-api.
This project development is going to be restarted and by that
reason it should be fully compliant to Python CI.

Change-Id: Ie9d84e3b0ea2f1853a69ba8cd393854fbec37198

commit_message:
Make fwaas multinode job nonvoting

Failures in the gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-fwaas-multinode job[1] are
taking some time to debug, so in order to unbreak the gate make the job
nonvoting until it stabilizes.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/20/408920/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-fwaas-multinode/fb4c087/logs/new/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_2016-12-09_03_49_39_233

commit_message:
[Rally]Add some projects to the variable $PROJECT

Add diskimage-builder and tripleo-image-elements to
the variable $PROJECT. It was failed when installing
octavia service,because git_clone diskimage-builder was
failed in octavia_install.
The related link:
https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L12
http://paste.openstack.org/show/592062/

Change-Id: Ia4973812cf1e2fa867af1126ff73467a34c79cc7

commit_message:
Revert "Remove magnum from shade's gate"

Add the magnum config back to shade's gate jobs once the offending swift
disablement is done in magnum's gate hook.

This reverts commit 0e098421e2ffaff3bacb2cb3063d030d5599de72.

commit_message:
Cleanup some neutron -nv job handling

Instead of using "voting: false", we name jobs in general "-nv". Change
some jobs to follow this pattern:

Remove voting: false for
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full, the jobs have already
-nv.

Change gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-.*,
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-full-.* jobs to -nv.

Rename gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty and
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-ovs-native-ubuntu-trusty to -nv, and
remove special condition for them, these settings are the default.
This includes taking them out of devstack-jobs and explicitely defining
them.

Use -nv suffix for
gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet-v1-ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: I76a7dc5c2868e535fb4481d838f0d0e83066c41d

commit_message:
remove cueclient from osc check script

due to the current status of the cue project being independent,
no commits to the client in ~6 months [1], and no release in one
year [2]; i propose we remove the client from the osc checker.

it currently emits a deprecation warning, which was attempted to
be fixed [3] but abandoned since no one reviewed it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-cueclient/commits/master
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-cueclient/releases
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333747/

Change-Id: I6b5d3e74a227692e4c4f9ac1aac3af255d3726d2

commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

commit_message:
Remove invalid tests for config option osapi_compute_workers

Config option osapi_compute_workers is integer with min=1, that
means any value < 1 will raise ValueError in runtime. Method
set_override of ConfigOpts will not check value when enforce_type=False,
In the future release of oslo.config, will set parameter enforce_type
with True by default.

This commit fixes warning as follow:
DeprecationWarning: The argument enforce_type is changing its default
value to True and then will be removed completely, please fix the
invalid Integer(min=1) value '0' for option 'osapi_compute_workers'. in
version '4.0'

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I7da19419ed13e5d0602bbf5028c3cf7ae30c3c62

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 03:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/fixture.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/036d245a5ef6c6f6f11b6c5915179bae392eae1e', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using

will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

Change-Id: I8b1e3dd75c700c3c2d41223309cd6c3af1ebdddc

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8b1e3dd75c700c3c2d41223309cd6c3af1ebdddc

commit_message:
Enable Nova driver in gate pipeline

This setup the CI to run devstack with Nova driver. Then, run the
tempest tests againest it.

In addition, this commit performed the following fixes in order to
pass the CI check:
* Switch from hv_type to fields.HVType
* Switch from vm_mode to fields.VMMode
See the related changes in Nova [1][2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/356424/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/356553/

Closes-Bug: #1649021
Change-Id: Icf3c48d00b49ee16fe42adfc6d0bd41bfecaf938

commit_message:
Hyper-V: fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Closes-Bug: #1565895
(cherry picked from commit 8c40c4268be57ff2f76cf616b53992b0d32e1fd3)

deleted_lines: def synchronize_with_path(f): def wrapper(self, image_path): @utils.synchronized(image_path) def inner(): return f(self, image_path) return inner() return wrapper @utils.synchronized(resized_vhd_path) @utils.synchronized(base_vhd_path) self.remove_old_image(img) @synchronize_with_path def remove_old_image(self, img): self._pathutils.remove(img)

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

Change-Id: I08e6ba931c598c857c6de7fc0740b6b2c7fd2988

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 07:04:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8edd97229e363f0a80a0df94e2a602ccc37a45c6', 'message': 'Optimize trunk details extension hook

commit_message:
Optimize trunk details extension hook

As per findings [1], the hook was found to be a burden. That is
because of the lazy join on every DB lookup required to fetch
the MAC for the subport. Instead of issuing a gazillion JOINs
(one per each subport), this patch modifies the loop and speed
it up at the expenses of some temporary memory cost: it does so
by building a temporary map, looking up ports by IDs (which is
bleeding fast) and reassembling the data from the temp map as
the API expects it to be. Pronto!

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron_Trunk_API_Performance_and_Scaling#surprise_effect_on_filtered_port_listings

Closes-bug: #bug/1648714

Change-Id: I58e39dbf1c83e1204d8d7f436395531ca096b1ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/83/408983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron import context subports = { x.port_id: {'segmentation_id': x.segmentation_id, 'segmentation_type': x.segmentation_type, 'port_id': x.port_id} for x in port_db.trunk_port.sub_ports } ports = core_plugin.get_ports( context.get_admin_context(), filters={'id': subports}) for port in ports: subports[port['id']]['mac_address'] = port['mac_address'] 'sub_ports': [x for x in subports.values()]}
deleted_lines: subports = [{'segmentation_id': x.segmentation_id, 'segmentation_type': x.segmentation_type, 'port_id': x.port_id, 'mac_address': x.port.mac_address} for x in port_db.trunk_port.sub_ports] 'sub_ports': subports}

commit_message:
Run Cinder in-tree tests: lvm-multibackend

We want to run Cinder in-tree tests additionally to the one already in tempest
tree. This commit changes the gate-tempest-dsvm-lvm-multibackend job to do so.

Change-Id: Id79366b92a0bd334b6223058c4cec4792e648226

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/31/407831/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Regex Denial of Service (ReDoS) * JSON Parser Depth Limit An `XSS`_ attack is one where malicious JavaScript is injected into a webRegex Denial of Service (ReDoS) ------------------------------- `ReDoS`_ attack is one that produces a denial of service by providing a regular epression that takes a very long time to evaluate and hence causing infinite regex backtracking, which can make some parsers halt the process or keep on trying to match. The attack exploits the fact that most regular expression implementations have exponential time worst case complexity: the time taken can grow exponentially in relation to input size. JSON Parser Depth Limit ----------------------- There is a possibility for the JSON parser to reach depth limit and crash, hence resulting in a successful overflow of the json parsers depth limit leading to a DoS vulnerability. Syntribos tries checking for that and raises an issue if the parser crashes. .. _ReDoS: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ReDoS **Details
deleted_lines: An XSS_ attack is one where malicious JavaScript is injected into a web **Details**

commit_message:
Fixing sphnix fail issue

Sphnix warning for non local uri (Repository tags) is causing
tox -e docs to fail, I am moving the tags data from the docs to
the readme script. The tags will be added to readme.rst, when the
doc is generated. This fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ia849050b692bc3675b44366d8cd37c47d5cf2fc0

commit_message:
Tag final liberty releases for Glance

Liberty has reached it's end of life. This tags the final liberty
releases for all three Glance managed projects:

- Glance
- glance-store
- python-glanceclient

Change-Id: I3719292b13535a3c456eb0075cd2573d934c4c82

commit_message:
Correct  reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I59621eef6060928f63ac937527a4421eed266738

deleted_lines: except Exception as e: raise e

commit_message:
Remove if-statements for checking dse or dse2

Congress only supports dse2 architecture now. It's not needed to
check whether dse or dse2.

Change-Id: I0d1b187747d5c5a248bcb6ddd0febc7845d1b2bb

commit_message:
Add version map search to base object

This patch adds a map to the base SenlinObject class so that API request
version can be used to search for an appropriate object version for use.

commit_message:
Augment request context with api microversion

This patch augments the request context with api microversion request.
We will use this info later to determine the request object to create
and use.

Change-Id: I63c7a6481593d0b4f81b16a5e09834dc34c805bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/70/408970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Build context from authentication info extracted from request.""" api_version = str(req.version_request) roles=roles, api_version=api_version )
deleted_lines: '''Build context from authentication info extracted from request.''' roles=roles)

commit_message:
Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235

commit_message:
test: fix wrong usage of config option in test_window

Developers usually use method CONF.set_override to change
config option's value in tests. By default the parameter
enforce_type=False, it doesn't check any type or value of
override. If set enforce_type=True , will check parameter
verride type and value. In production code, oslo_config
always checks config option's value. In short, we test and
run code in different ways. For more details when we set method
set_override with parameter enforce_type=True, please see:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839
Change-Id: I0e1929f7e6afa9b9d5daa15e04418b7111ab9e2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/334877/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix wrong usage of config option gpfs_images_share_mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 09:05:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/215d38d4549c24536820146bea3123914c82e7ff', 'message': "Fix wrong usage of config opiton gpfs_images_share_mode

Config option gpfs_images_share_mode with paramter choices=['copy',
'copy_on_write', None], that means any other value will raise
ValueError, so don't check other values.
For more details when we set method set_override with paramter
enforce_type=True, please see: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

commit_message:
Fix wrong usage of config option gpfs_images_share_mode

Config option gpfs_images_share_mode with parameter choices=['copy',
'copy_on_write', None], that means any other value will raise
ValueError, the check is done by the configuration parser, so no
invalid value will be accepted and the driver doesn't need to check it
again. For more details when we set method set_override with paramter
enforce_type=True, please see: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523740/

Related-Bug: 1517839

Change-Id: I000ab639e68534e7be111cc3759b6ae1dffd5520

deleted_lines: # fail configuration.gpfs_images_share_mode not in # ['copy_on_write', 'copy'] org_value = self.driver.configuration.gpfs_images_share_mode self.flags(volume_driver=self.driver_name, gpfs_images_share_mode='copy_on_read') self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.driver.check_for_setup_error) self.flags(volume_driver=self.driver_name, gpfs_images_share_mode=org_value) gpfs_images_share_mode='test') def test_is_cloneable_fail_config(self, mock_is_gpfs_path): self.flags(volume_driver=self.driver_name, gpfs_images_share_mode='') CONF.gpfs_images_dir = '' mock_is_gpfs_path.return_value = None self.assertNotEqual((True, None, os.path.join(CONF.gpfs_images_dir, '12345')), self.driver._is_cloneable('12345')) @mock.patch('cinder.volume.drivers.ibm.gpfs.GPFSDriver._is_gpfs_path') gpfs_images_share_mode='test')

added_lines: @request_context2 def action_delete2(self, ctx, req): """Delete the specified action object. :param ctx: An instance of the request context. :param req: An instance of the ActionDeleteRequest object. :return: None if deletion was successful, or an exception of type `ResourceInUse`. """ db_action = self.action_find(ctx, req.identity) LOG.info(_LI("Deleting action '%s'."), req.identity) try: action_mod.Action.delete(ctx, db_action.id) except exception.EResourceBusy: reason = _("still in one of WAITING, RUNNING or SUSPENDED state") raise exception.ResourceInUse(type='action', id=req.identity, reason=reason) LOG.info(_LI("Action '%s' is deleted."), req.identity)

commit_message:
Add debug envrioment into tox

Add "import pdb; pdb.set_trace()" into the test case code. Then we
could use "tox -e debug-{py27,py34}" to debug into it. Tox will run
"manage.py test --pdb" which really debug our test cases.

Change-Id: If704f648ad327bc0e66516656ba1169b5b7e539e
Closes-bug: #1534030
Partially-Implements: blueprint enhance-tox
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/61/325861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = pep8,py27{-horizon,-openstack_dashboard,dj18},py34,debug-{py27,py34},releasenotes[testenv:debug-py27] whitelist_externals = bash commands = bash -c 'project=`echo {posargs} | cut -d. -f1`; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test {posargs} --pdb --settings=$project.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests;' [testenv:debug-py34] basepython = python3.4 whitelist_externals = bash commands = bash -c 'project=`echo {posargs} | cut -d. -f1`; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test {posargs} --pdb --settings=$project.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests;'

commit_message:
support reset the state of cgsnapshots

Add reset-state API to support reset
the state of cgsnapshots to the right state.

Change-Id: Ic7cea2c70a88c18c891b109f4ca755a744e6a427
Implements: bp cgsnapshot-reset-state
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/403662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from cinder.api.openstack import api_version_request as api_version from cinder.api.v3 import cgsnapshots from cinder import context from cinder import db from cinder import objects from cinder.objects import fields from cinder import test from cinder.tests.unit.api import fakes from cinder.tests.unit import fake_constants as fake from cinder.tests.unit import utils import cinder.volume class CgsnapshotsAPITestCase(test.TestCase): """Test Case for cgsnapshots API.""" def setUp(self): super(CgsnapshotsAPITestCase, self).setUp() self.volume_api = cinder.volume.API() self.context = context.get_admin_context() self.context.project_id = fake.PROJECT_ID self.context.user_id = fake.USER_ID self.user_ctxt = context.RequestContext( fake.USER_ID, fake.PROJECT_ID, auth_token=True) self.controller = cgsnapshots.CgsnapshotsController() def test_cgsnapshot_reset_state(self): consistencygroup = utils.create_consistencygroup(self.context) volume_id = utils.create_volume(self.context, consistencygroup_id= consistencygroup.id)['id'] cgsnapshot = utils.create_cgsnapshot( self.context, consistencygroup_id=consistencygroup.id, status=fields.CgsnapshotStatus.AVAILABLE) req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v3/%s/cgsnapshots/%s/action' % (fake.PROJECT_ID, cgsnapshot.id)) req.environ['cinder.context'].is_admin = True req.headers['Content-Type'] = 'application/json' req.headers['OpenStack-API-Version'] = 'volume 3.16' req.api_version_request = api_version.APIVersionRequest('3.16') test_state = 'error' body = {'os-reset_status': {'status': test_state}} res_dict = self.controller.reset_status( req, cgsnapshot.id, body) cgsnapshot = objects.CGSnapshot.get_by_id( self.context, cgsnapshot.id) self.assertEqual(202, res_dict.status_int) self.assertEqual(test_state, cgsnapshot.status) test_state = 'available' body = {'os-reset_status': {'status': test_state}} res_dict = self.controller.reset_status( req, cgsnapshot.id, body) cgsnapshot = objects.CGSnapshot.get_by_id( self.context, cgsnapshot.id) self.assertEqual(202, res_dict.status_int) self.assertEqual(test_state, cgsnapshot.status) consistencygroup.destroy() db.volume_destroy(context.get_admin_context(), volume_id) cgsnapshot.destroy()
