commit_message:
[DOCS] Remove hacking H303

It was documented that tox ignores hacking H303 but that has since
been removed (the rule and all) so this change removes it from the
documentation.

Change-Id: I7b9315b30a174272e1bc88f89b443fac257edb53

commit_message:
Check for ocsp_on in PKCS config [+Docs]

This patch adds a verification for ocsp_on in the PAM PKCS 11
configuration file (if present).

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I53e6ff4a7cc55e174d4ae2976b1c2118317f4964
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/50/407650/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: verification only tag: authThe tasks in the security role examine the ``/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf`` file (if it exists) to ensure that ``ocsp_on`` is included in all three ``cert_policy`` directives. If ``oscp_on`` is not found three times in the file, a message is printed in the Ansible output. This change is only needed on systems which use PKI-based authentication (using certificates).
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Set audisp failure options [+Docs]

This patch adds configurations for audisp when the disk is rull on the remote
server or when there is a network interruption between the local system and
the remote audisp server.

It also explicitly installs auditd/audisp-plugins to ensure that auditd and
the remote audisp log sender are installed on CentOS/RHEL.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I589ae00a70582ee3f5d48453b3c20f23752adfa6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/50/407550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the action to take when the disk is full or network events cannot be sent. security_rhel7_auditd_disk_full_action: syslog # RHEL-07-030340 security_rhel7_auditd_network_failure_action: syslog # RHEL-07-030340

commit_message:
Add AIDE checks for ACL/xattrs [+Docs]

CentOS/RHEL have strict AIDE configs, but Ubuntu's configuration needs
extra configuration. This patch adds lines to the end of Ubuntu's AIDE
confgiuration to meet the requirements of RHEL-07-021600,
RHEL-07-021610, and RHEL-07-021620.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I107fa931f80d6871195027be0ed8db4105e2ddf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/30/407530/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: implemented tag: aideCentOS 7 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 already deploy a very secure AIDE configuration that checks access control lists (ACLs) and extended attributes by default. No configuration changes are applied on these systems. However, Ubuntu lacks the rules that include ACL and extended attribute checks. The tasks in the security role will add a small configuration block at the end of the AIDE configuration file to meet the requirements of this STIG, as well as RHEL-07-021610.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Prevent extra names from being sent in port create

Neutron is strict in what it accepts, so
openstack.network.create_port is failing with an HttpException and
details about unrecognized attributes when setting, e.g.,
binding_vnic_type. This is because the old resource class, which network
is currently based on, didn't transform binding_vnic_type into
binding:vnic_type, it just sent both of them.

While https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364052 will solve this in the
long term by transitioning to resource2, where we don't have this sort
of problem with sending extra names, we would need to wait for it and
all other related changes to merge and also be released, so I'd prefer
to make this small change that will tie us over until that larger effort
is completed. This shouldn't affect that change much as this is just
adding an extra method on the Port class, not changing anything else in
the prop names.

Change-Id: I235d129f6caf640b6fe9a657f9b9f6e505a73d68
Closes-Bug: 1625579
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/28/408628/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy @classmethod def create_by_id(cls, session, attrs, resource_id=None, path_args=None): """Create a remote resource from its attributes. :param session: The session to use for making this request. :type session: :class:`~openstack.session.Session` :param dict attrs: The attributes to be sent in the body of the request. :param resource_id: This resource's identifier, if needed by the request. The default is ``None``. :param dict path_args: A dictionary of arguments to construct a compound URL. See `How path_args are used`_ for details. :return: A ``dict`` representing the response body. :raises: :exc:`~openstack.exceptions.MethodNotSupported` if :data:`Resource.allow_create` is not set to ``True``. """ # Convert attributes from Resource types into their ids. attrs = cls.convert_ids(attrs) headers = attrs.pop(resource.HEADERS, None) body = cls._get_create_body(attrs) # Neutron is strict about not accepting keys it doesn't know how # to handle. When this moves to resource2 we won't have this problem, # but for right now we need to make sure these names don't go through # as they're aliased into names that have colons, and Neutron only # expects those names. for name in ("binding_vnic_type", "binding_vif_type", "binding_vif_details", "binding_profile", "binding_host_id"): if name in body['port']: body['port'].pop(name) url = cls._get_url(path_args, resource_id) args = {'json': body} if headers: args[resource.HEADERS] = headers resp = session.post(url, endpoint_filter=cls.service, **args) resp_headers = resp.headers resp = resp.json() resp = resp[cls.resource_key] if resp_headers: resp[resource.HEADERS] = copy.deepcopy(resp_headers) return resp

commit_message:
Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects

We want to update both the attach_volume API and
detach_volume API to use volume versionedobjects.

There are three patches for it in the chain.

- Update attach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update test cases related to attach_volume()
  and detach_volume() in file
  cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

This patch updates attach_volume API to use
volume versionedobjects.  Changes were made to
be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

Change-Id: I0ef693a9c3d72349563e7199aa27a0724f98a774

commit_message:
Add sleep(2) when try to delete a container

Even though in devstack this test pass successfully, the same
don't happen in HA deployment. It takes a few seconds to
synchronize the deletion of the objects between the controllers
in order to delete the container. Without this time this test
fails consistently in tripleo as you can see in the logs at
http://bit.ly/2gMDl8d.
Adding the sleep makes the HA proxy have enough time to sync
the deletion of the objects, and the container is deleted
successfully.

Change-Id: I76f6493d1429166bef9804f2fbf2acdc02425489
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/405483/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time After delete all the objects from a container, it will wait 2 seconds before delete the container itself, in order to deployments using HA proxy sync the deletion properly, otherwise, the container might fail to be deleted because it's not empty. # sleep 2 seconds to sync the deletion of the objects # in HA deployment time.sleep(2)

commit_message:
start datasource drivers before policy engine

Also starts API last to avoid accepting API requests before other
services are up.

HA doc updated to start DSD node before PE nodes.

commit_message:
SRIOV: don't block report_state with device count

The device count process can be quite slow on a system with
lots of interfaces. Doing this during report_state can block
it long enough that the agent will be reported as dead and
bindings will fail.

This adjusts the logic to only update the configuration during
the normal device retrieval for the scan loop. This will leave
the report_state loop unblocked by the operation so the agent
doesn't get reported as dead (which blocks port binding).

Closes-Bug: #1648206
Change-Id: Iff45fb6617974b1eceeed238a8d9e958f874f12b

commit_message:
Move get_instance() calls from try-except block

common.get_instance() raises a single exception HTTPNotFound only,
so it is not necessary to call the method in try-except block on
these cases.
This patch moves these calls from the block so that we will be
able to avoid digging what exceptions are raised on the method in
the future (On Ie1fc20fe5e028dd53116d5549814442232ddfe49 review,
we faced such situation).

Change-Id: I7c3898f79dfdd069c52de9327b7f5ec45786c8d6

commit_message:
Remove dict-compat from the image object

This patch removes the need of having dictcompat from
the image object. Luckily we have around 5 objects in
zun that would need this changes.

DictCompat is not really needed, since that's the old
way of referencing an object field just like a dictionary
object in python.

Currently a better way needs to be implemented to avoid
conversion of the image object to a dict
back and forth. This could be achieved if we implement
the API validation blueprint.

Change-Id: Ia0f5a4415b70934e7d47d77594f0d43ae6cb65bc
Partially-Implements: blueprint rm-object-dict-compat

commit_message:
Ensure correct VPNaaS package is installed

Trusty uses `openswan` and Xenial uses `strongswan`. This patch
ensures that the correct packages are installed in each distro
if the deployer chooses to deploy VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Iab6ed9cb24e07005cf6334253677689b68e344a5
Closes-Bug: #1645396
(cherry picked from commit c1c28c65a54445ee27c778866ec8edcf5df367cd)

commit_message:
wait after killing polling thread

There may be a period of time when the polling
thread is still active and attempts to interact with
a no longer existing datasource driver, leading to errors.

The errors that interrupt the stdout/stderr of a subsequent
test appears to be responsible for the occasional subunit
parser checksum errors not resolved by this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408439/

Change-Id: I5b0e17da12e564911f2341e7121b3672c00e27eb

commit_message:
Add API test for tag

This patch adds api test for tag.

Change-Id: I87aba26534db179f0744ddee982251e8e1834638
Partial-Implements: blueprint add-tags-to-core-resources
Related-Bug: #1489291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/292204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_tags(self, resource_type, resource_id): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id) resp, body = self.get(uri) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = json.loads(body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def get_tag(self, resource_type, resource_id, tag): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags/%s' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id, tag) resp, body = self.get(uri) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) def update_tag(self, resource_type, resource_id, tag): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags/%s' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id, tag) resp, body = self.put(uri, None) self.expected_success(201, resp.status) def update_tags(self, resource_type, resource_id, body): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id) req_body = json.dumps(body) resp, res_body = self.put(uri, req_body) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) res_body = json.loads(res_body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, res_body) def delete_tags(self, resource_type, resource_id): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id) resp, body = self.delete(uri) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) def delete_tag(self, resource_type, resource_id, tag): uri = '%s/%s/%s/tags/%s' % ( self.uri_prefix, resource_type, resource_id, tag) resp, body = self.delete(uri) self.expected_success(204, resp.status)

commit_message:
Always check enable_* variables first

Check enable_* variables first, then check inventory_host in
group, will help to avoid configuration errors.

Change-Id: Icdb1f50e5c911203b92ac431723620756b15f3c6
Closes-Bug: #1648376

commit_message:
Fix some slow unit tests

- patch DB retry count for tests excercising retry decorator.
  These tests were taking 40 seconds per run (one used by 4 classes)
  by going through the full retry count with backoff. ~240 seconds of
  CPU time lost to them.
- Adjust vsctl_timeout down on ofport retry test.
  This one was taking up to 10 seconds with the default timeout.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Iabe99c06abde81ced7e8dfa48bfe8b066c59ce70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/408812/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Speed-up iptables_manager remove_chain() code

remove_chain() has three list iterations that can be
reduced to two, brings a small performance increase.

Change-Id: I6f6e05b2336a983062f4787cb933d56fdf71a90a
Partial-bug: #1642770
(cherry picked from commit 5ff8aecefb69ed4ea97b45725f0da29611694987)

deleted_lines: # first, add rules to remove that have a matching chain name self.remove_rules += [str(r) for r in self.rules if r.chain == name] # next, remove rules from list that have a matching chain name self.rules = [r for r in self.rules if r.chain != name] if not wrap: # next, add rules to remove that have a matching jump chain if jump_snippet in r.rule] # finally, remove rules from list that have a matching jump chain if jump_snippet not in r.rule]

The other_config columns in OVSDB are defined as maps with string
keys and string values. The OVS agent was passing an integer
segmentation id and could pass None as the physical_network.
Unfortunately, the upstream Python OVS library does not pass the

Change-Id: Iafa6be3749b1ee863f5fa71150c708fc46951510

commit_message:
Only send string values to OVSDB other_config column

The other_config columns in OVSDB are defined as maps with string
keys and string values. The OVS agent was passing an integer
segmentation id and could pass None as the physical_network.
Unfortunately, the upstream Python OVS library does not pass the
exceptions through to us.

Change-Id: Iafa6be3749b1ee863f5fa71150c708fc46951510
Closes-Bug: #1630920
(cherry picked from commit 3d500d36608e83d202c1a6c8438ea5961a7debe1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/408825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'physical_network': 'None'}

commit_message:
Add janitor to cleanup orphaned fip ports

This adds a janitor worker to the L3 DB module that
will run every 5 minutes looking for floating IP ports
with the device_id of 'PENDING'. If it finds any, it
will keep track of the port ID to see if any stay in
'PENDING' with the next iteration.

If the device ID is still PENDING after 5 minutes, it
means one of two things has happened. Either the server
died after creating the floating IP port, but before
creating the floating IP itself; or, it died after creating
the floating IP port and the floating IP record, but before
updating the device_id of the floating IP port to the
floating IP ID.

The janitor handles both cases by deleting the floating IP
port if it has no associated floating IP and by updating
the floating IP port device ID if it does have an associated
floating IP.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Closes-Bug: #1648098
Change-Id: I684a822553a5a0c54513ca7d20ccaf3c74180593
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/99/397499/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import randomfrom neutron._i18n import _, _LE, _LI, _LWfrom neutron import context as n_ctxfrom neutron import worker as neutron_worker inst = super(L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin, cls).__new__(cls) inst._start_janitor() return inst def _start_janitor(self): """Starts the periodic job that cleans up broken complex resources. This job will look for things like floating IP ports without an associated floating IP and delete them 5 minutes after detection. """ self._candidate_broken_flip_ports = set() interval = 60 * 5 # only every 5 minutes. cleanups should be rare initial_delay = random.randint(0, interval) # splay multiple servers janitor = neutron_worker.PeriodicWorker(self._clean_garbage, interval, initial_delay) self.add_worker(janitor) def _clean_garbage(self): context = n_ctx.get_admin_context() candidates = self._get_dead_floating_port_candidates(context) # just because a port is in 'candidates' doesn't necessarily mean # it's broken, we could have just caught it before it was updated. # We confirm by waiting until the next call of this function to see # if it persists. to_cleanup = candidates & self._candidate_broken_flip_ports self._candidate_broken_flip_ports = candidates - to_cleanup for port_id in to_cleanup: # ensure it wasn't just a failure to update device_id before we # delete it try: self._fix_or_kill_floating_port(context, port_id) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Error cleaning up floating IP port: %s"), port_id) def _fix_or_kill_floating_port(self, context, port_id): flip = (context.session.query(l3_models.FloatingIP). filter(floating_port_id=port_id).first()) if flip: LOG.warning(_LW("Found incorrect device_id on floating port " "%(pid)s, correcting to %(fip)s."), {'pid': port_id, 'fip': flip.id}) self._core_plugin.update_port( context, port_id, {'port': {'device_id': flip.id}}) else: LOG.warning(_LW("Found floating IP port %s without floating IP, " "deleting."), port_id) self._core_plugin.delete_port( context, port_id, l3_port_check=False) def _get_dead_floating_port_candidates(self, context): filters = {'device_id': ['PENDING'], 'device_owner': [DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP]} return {p['id'] for p in self._core_plugin.get_ports(context, filters)}
deleted_lines: from neutron._i18n import _, _LI return super(L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin, cls).__new__(cls) # TODO(kevinbenton): garbage collector that deletes ports that didn't # make it this far to handle servers dying in this process

We already have image and member schema test methods, so add
metadata schema test methods.

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html

commit_message:
Don't pass any --config-file arguments to neutron-db-manage

The plugin config file is not needed since Juno because now schema does
not depend on plugin used; and oslo.config is capable of finding
neutron.conf by the virtue of its auto-discovery mechanism.

Change-Id: Icc4de9824ef95781a1d060534973c2bbf8e03059

Fedora 25 recently moved to python3 as the default python version.

Trying to build docs errors on Fedora 25 during the venv build

commit_message:
Fix python version to 2.7 for docs

Fedora 25 recently moved to python3 as the default python version.

Trying to build docs errors on Fedora 25 during the venv build
due to feedformatter not being Py3 clean.  feedformatter is a
dependency of yasfb, making yasfb py27 only.

Change-Id: Iabf51bf9d576eb0794b1d06c641400a79a00ce23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/39/406339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython=python2.7

commit_message:
Have gate wait for dns ready

Kubernetes does not seem to properly set the Ready state on dns being
usable. This seems to be causing intermittent failures in the gate.
This ps adds a test to ensure dns is responsive on all nodes before
continuing.

Change-Id: I9e871c041dbdda6dac74c1cb283787550887237c

subject: Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 18:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/multiple-nics/compute-dvr.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8e5652ec8d1a22a72e6131ea000b47368f2d5664', 'message': "Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs

This change adds a NIC config to the multiple-nics sample NIC
config templates for a compute node running DVR. In order for
DVR to work on the compute nodes, they must share an external
bridge with the controllers. All of the other sample NIC
configs already have an external bridge (defaults to 'br-ex'),
but the multiple-nics compute role does not, so now the

multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I80fe2e5842a67984e1d4d8aa295c7607c4f340ad
"}]
commit_message:
Add NIC config for compute role for DVR with multiple NICs

This change adds a NIC config to the multiple-nics sample NIC
config templates for a compute node running DVR. In order for
DVR to work on the compute nodes, they must share an external
bridge with the controllers. All of the other sample NIC
configs already have an external bridge (defaults to 'br-ex'),
but the multiple-nics compute role does not, so now the
compute-dvr.yaml NIC template will demonstrate DVR with
multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I80fe2e5842a67984e1d4d8aa295c7607c4f340ad

commit_message:
Remove magnum from shade's gate

The magnum devstack plugin landed a change to disable swift. That
breaks shade's swift tests which tests functionality essential for Infra
production.

Turn off magnum support for now. We can revert this when the magnum
devstack plugin works again.

Change-Id: Iee92cb3e386651fb5a9669c3cf0bdedf1326d8b1

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I927609f06e5921e189487160ef46be830e422add
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Fix cinder_volumes is_metal override example

The example file that shows how to use an env.d file to override
the is_metal value for a service is functionally incorrect.

The file is missing the properties: dictionary level and without this
correct nesting of dictionaries, the is_metal value specified has no
effect on the inventory.

Change-Id: If73d22ff7dd6e5fec24f79217f721797effab651
(cherry picked from commit fb8cb1614c0e9bf5bfd97972012d5e9ce1efdc03)

commit_message:
Add validator for device owner

Currently it is possible to assign multiple
gateway ports to a router. This patch add a validator
to prevent this behavior and also allow for any further
validations based on the device owners.

Change-Id: I1a42576f183271ad04f62b0b8ab25a813fd3b2cf
Partial-Bug: #1430345

commit_message:
Defer auth prompting until it is actually needed

Auth option prompting happens waaaay to early in the default
os-client-config flow, we need to defer it until adter the commands
have been parsed.  This is why ClientManager.setup_auth() exists,
as it is not called until the first attempt to connect to a server
occurs.  Commands that do not require authentication never hit this.

Also, required options were not being enforced.  By doing this we handle
when no authentication info is present, we fail on missing auth-url rather
than attempt to prompt for a password (default auth is password).

Closes-Bug: 1619274
Change-Id: Ia4eae350e6904c9eb2c8507d9b3429fe52418726
(cherry picked from commit 14dbfe44741b65c9e0514a34669f52de8629b1c0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/12/372712/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setup_auth(self): """Set up authentication""" if self._auth_setup_completed: return # NOTE(dtroyer): Validate the auth args; this is protected with 'if' # because openstack_config is an optional argument to # CloudConfig.__init__() and we'll die if it was not # passed. if self._cli_options._openstack_config is not None: self._cli_options._openstack_config._pw_callback = \ shell.prompt_for_password self._cli_options._auth = \ self._cli_options._openstack_config.load_auth_plugin( self._cli_options.config, ) return super(ClientManager, self).setup_auth()

commit_message:
Ensure separate filesystems exist [+Docs]

This STIG has requirements for separate filesystems for some mounts, but this
can only be done during the initial provisioning process.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I70b6e929b54648bfa7af62005a7d9ab2f397db22

commit_message:
Disable horizon, ceilomter and swift in gate hook

If the services are disabled in the devstack/settings file, it disables
them for everyone who uses the magnum devstack plugin. Some people (like
shade) use both magnum and swift to test things. Putting this in the
gate hook means it's used in all of magnum's jobs, but not in other
people's jobs.

Change-Id: Icd82a4ab68533f39f967575c2125b0f61c70e0a6

commit_message:
Add support of endpoint_type and region_name to clients manila uses

Since change [1] it is impossible to set endpoint_type and region_name
for nova, cinder and neutron clients that are used by manila in some
cases.
So, to fix it, add additional options called 'endpoint_type' and
'region_name' for each of config groups related to these clients.
These options can be defined in appropriate config group as following:

[nova]
endpoint_type = publicURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[cinder]
endpoint_type = internalURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[neutron]
endpoint_type = adminURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

Change-Id: I6be0e77bbc0e4b1e9905eba7a7b48ff540e9e377
Closes-Bug: #1633454
(cherry picked from commit 11b38f3188686368412cdbb22ef55570720e3002)

commit_message:
Remove Unneeded API Calls, Functions

Removed get_object call making a Nova API call.

instance_id is already passed into the view, thus making
the server_get not needed since snapshot_create only needs
the name of the snapshot and instance_id.

Removed get test case since there is no possibility of an except
being thrown from failed API call.

Change-Id: I6c1324ee4c703d01d861408f68eea2eaaf2ca901

commit_message:
Attach rework V2

*********** For illustration purposes only ***********

This is just a quick hack to share with an alternate approach
to the attach flow in Cinder.  It's not tested, doesn't have
a nova branch yet, and likely has some holes in it.

The purpose however is to contrast condensing init/attach and
term/detach (V2 attach flow proposal) and a less dramatic change
that for the most part just cleans up the flow we already have,
gets rid of all the crazy ``if this-param: elif that-param...``

This approach tries to simplify things, store a connector and access
records strictly by attachment_id.  This also would take previous
ideas around how to do multi-attach and clean them up making it
easier to achieve that goal.

Change-Id: Idd29008fd67c94e73f400165595d9700f37ceb01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/382045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.volume_rpcapi.detach_volume(context, volume, attachment_id) @wrap_check_policy def attachments_list(self, context, volume_id): return self.db.volume_attachments_get_all_by_volume_id(context, volume_id) @wrap_check_policy def attachment_get(self, context, attachment_id): return self.db.volume_attachment_get(context, attachment_id) @wrap_check_policy def connection_create_or_update(self, ctxt, volume, connector, attachment_id=None): connection_info = self.volume_rpcapi.connection_create_or_update( ctxt, volume, connector, attachment_id) LOG.info(_LI("Create/Update connection completed successfully."), resource=volume) return connection_info @wrap_check_policy def connection_terminate(self, ctxt, volume, attachment_id, force=False): safe_to_remove = self.volume_rpcapi.connection_terminate( ctxt, volume, attachment_id, force) LOG.info(_LI("Terminate connection completed successfully."), resource=volume) return safe_to_remove @wrap_check_policy def attachment_finalize(self, ctxt, volume, attachment_id, instance_id, mountpoint, mode): self.volume_rpcapi.attachment_finalize( ctxt, volume, attachment_id, instance_id, mountpoint, mode) LOG.info(_LI("Finalize attachment completed successfully."), resource=volume) # We don't need to return anything here probably, the caller has the # attach_id, and we've persisted everything in the attachment record so # that should be enough @wrap_check_policy def attachment_delete(self, ctxt, volume, attachment_id): self.volume_rpcapi.attachment_delete( ctxt, volume, attachment_id) LOG.info(_LI("Delete attachment completed successfully."), resource=volume)
deleted_lines: detach_results = self.volume_rpcapi.detach_volume(context, volume, attachment_id) return detach_results

commit_message:
Add new attach/detach API calls

******* WIP *********

This patch adds the cooresponding calls of the Cinder
'add new atttach/detach API calls' to the client.

These include:
1. create_attachment
2. remove_attachment
3. list_attachments

We also added create/remove and list attachments to the cli.

Depends-On: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b

Change-Id: Ib4d229778b9f691ae86fca50059cca4c0958fcf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/09/327409/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_attachment(self, volume, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): """Create an attachment for the specified volume. :param volume: The :class:`Volume` (or its ID). :param connector: connector dict from nova. :param instance_uuid: UUID of the Instance being attached to :param mountpoint: Mountpoin on the Instance being attached to """ return self.manager.create_attachment(self, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint) def remove_attachment(self, volume, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): """Remove an attachment for the specified volume. :param volume: The :class:`Volume` (or its ID). :param connector: connector dict from nova. :param connector: connector dict from nova. :param instance_uuid: UUID of the Instance being attached to """ return self.manager.remove_attachment(self, connector) def create_attachment(self, volume, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): """Create a volume attachment. :param volume: The :class:`Volume` (or its ID). :param connector: connector dict from nova. :param instance_uuid: UUID of the Instance being attached to. :param mountpoint: The mountpoint on the Instance being attached to. """ resp, body = self._action('os-create_attachment', volume, {'connector': connector, 'instance_uuid': instance_uuid, 'mountpoint': mountpoint}) return common_base.DictWithMeta(body['connection_info'], resp) def remove_attachment(self, volume, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): """Remove a volume attachment. :param volume: The :class:`Volume` (or its ID). :param connector: connector dict from nova. :param instance_uuid: UUID of the Instance being attached to. :param mountpoint: The mountpoint on the Instance being attached to. """ resp, body = self._action('os-remove_attachment', volume, {'connector': connector, 'instance_uuid': instance_uuid, 'mountpoint': mountpoint}) return common_base.ListWithMeta([], resp) def get_attachments(self, volume): """Get active attachments for the specified volume. :param volume: The :class:`Volume` (or its ID). """ resp, body = self._action('os-get_attachments', volume) return common_base.ListWithMeta([], resp)

subject: Add new attach/detach API calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 23:02:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6dd7b689de4ef8efc57191b61670860ce1fda71d', 'message': "Add new attach/detach API calls

***************    WIP    *************************
This patch aims to make the attach/detach process a bit
simpler and less prone to race conditions and solve
some confusion in it's usage.

For the first step we aren't implementing much, just
some new calls for attach and detach.  We'll call them
create/remove_attachment for now, and they'll just consolidate
all of the calls we used to make.

For example, instead of:
 1. reserve
 2. initialize
 3. attach

We'll just call create_attachment(volume, connector,
                                  instance_uuid, mountpoint)

For now that will simply call the existing initialize_connection
and attach methods, but the advantage here is it's a single call
for the consumer, and more importantly we can require all of the
various info we need up front.  This solves things like
multi-attach problems, because now we have all the info from
initialize, when we make the call to attach.

Eventually the old steps should be reimplemented and made more
efficient than they are currently, but if we get past this first
step we can have a stable, easy to use API to work off of that
shouldn't have to change AND best of all we don't break any
compatability.

Change-Id: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b

For example, instead of:
 1. reserve
 2. initialize
 3. attach

We'll just call create_attachment(volume, connector,
                                  instance_uuid, mountpoint)

For now that will simply call the existing initialize_connection
and attach methods, but the advantage here is it's a single call
for the consumer, and more importantly we can require all of the
various info we need up front.  This solves things like
multi-attach problems, because now we have all the info from
initialize, when we make the call to attach.

Eventually the old steps should be reimplemented and made more
efficient than they are currently, but if we get past this first
step we can have a stable, easy to use API to work off of that
shouldn't have to change AND best of all we don't break any
compatability.

Change-Id: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b

commit_message:
Add new attach/detach API calls

****** WIP *********
TODO:
1. Add the ack on connect/disconnect option for Nova
2. Unit tests
3. List/Get/Update Attachments
4. Figure out why os-brick/privsep pukes on unshelve
****** WIP *********

Latest modifications:
----------------------
10/6/16
  Added the no-connect flag to deal with attaching to
  shelved instances.  Uses an update_attachment to update
  and perform the connection on unshelve, also fixes the
  problem of detaching from a shelved instance that was
  never unshelved
---------------------

This patch aims to make the attach/detach process a bit
simpler and less prone to race conditions and solve
some confusion in it's usage.

For the first step we aren't implementing much, just
some new calls for attach and detach.  We'll call them
create/remove_attachment for now, and they'll just consolidate
all of the calls we used to make.

For example, instead of:
 1. reserve
 2. initialize
 3. attach

We'll just call create_attachment(volume, connector,
                                  instance_uuid, mountpoint)

For now that will simply call the existing initialize_connection
and attach methods, but the advantage here is it's a single call
for the consumer, and more importantly we can require all of the
various info we need up front.  This solves things like
multi-attach problems, because now we have all the info from
initialize, when we make the call to attach.

Eventually the old steps should be reimplemented and made more
efficient than they are currently, but if we get past this first
step we can have a stable, easy to use API to work off of that
shouldn't have to change AND best of all we don't break any
compatability.

Change-Id: I90d54257862e1815a03ca8750040f7e4e6f35c0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/08/327408/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.volume_rpcapi.detach_volume(context, volume, attachment_id) # BUG(jdg): This should be issued by the caller prior to the terminate # call, this is a source of race conditions in the detach process @wrap_check_policy def create_attachment(self, context, volume_ref, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): if volume_ref['status'] == 'maintenance': LOG.info(_LI('Unable to create attachment for ' 'volume because it is in ' 'maintenance.'), resource=volume_ref) msg = _("Unable to create attachment for volume " "while it is in maintenance mode.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) attach_results = self.volume_rpcapi.create_attachment(context, volume_ref, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint) LOG.info(_LI("Create volume attachment completed successfully."), resource=volume_ref) return attach_results @wrap_check_policy def remove_attachment(self, context, volume_ref, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint): if volume_ref['status'] == 'maintenance': LOG.info(_LI('Unable to remove attachment for ' 'volume because it is in ' 'maintenance.'), resource=volume_ref) msg = _("Unable to remove attachment for volume " "while it is in maintenance mode.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) remaining_attachments = self.volume_rpcapi.remove_attachment( context, volume_ref, connector, instance_uuid, mountpoint) LOG.info(_LI("Remove volume attachment completed successfully."), resource=volume_ref) # Returns the remaining attachments (if any) for the specified volume return remaining_attachments @wrap_check_policy def get_attachments_by_volume(self, context, volume_ref): return self.db.volume_attachment_get_all_by_volume_id( context, volume_id) @wrap_check_policy def get_attachment(self, context, attachment_id): return self.db.volume_attachment_get(context, attachment_id)

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/09/396809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add subnet host routes host_routes = port.fixed_ips[0].subnet.host_routes for host_route in host_routes: if host_route.destination != "0.0.0.0/0": cmd = ['route', 'add', '-net', host_route.destination, 'gw', host_route.nexthop] ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(namespace=namespace) ip_wrapper.netns.execute(cmd, check_exit_code=False)

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/32/403632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add subnet host routes host_routes = port.fixed_ips[0].subnet.host_routes for host_route in host_routes: if host_route.destination != "0.0.0.0/0": cmd = ['route', 'add', '-net', host_route.destination, 'gw', host_route.nexthop] ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(namespace=namespace) ip_wrapper.netns.execute(cmd, check_exit_code=False)

commit_message:
[proxy-api] microversion 2.39 deprecates image-metadata proxy API

Almost all proxy APIs were deprecated in microversion 2.36.
But the sub-resource image-metadata of image was forgotten to deprecate.
This patch deprecates the image-metdata API from 2.39.

Implements blueprint deprecate-image-meta-proxy-api
Closes-bug: #1614578

Change-Id: I5507337ab6fe4a377f66dec3fe275d75618cd7b4

commit_message:
gate-issue: Update tests to use fake clients

IndexError: list index out of range errors are seen while
executing py27 jobs as tests try to connect to real client
instead of fake ones while polling. This commit fixes the same.

Closes-Bug:#1648320
Change-Id: Ieb42e8265a6ada95a3430a3f78a01806f714be0e

commit_message:
Added retries in db_sync for nova_api db

That patch continue fixes made for LP#1628580
If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ie718efef81a24d0299fff83d39d04fac5a36fbb0
Related-Bug: #1628580
Related-Bug: #1647305
Closes-Bug: #1645474

Fix a string only containing a variable

Changes so that a string that only contained
a variable is changed to the variable so that
the module fully passes puppet-lint without
any warnings.

commit_message:
[extensions] cache discovered extensions

There are several OpenStack projects which use novaclient multiple times.
Each time new instance of novaclient is created and each time method
discover_extensions is called.

`discover_extensions` can take some "real" time to discover extensions via
python path and entry points. To reduce this time, let's cache the results.
To make it possible, we need to make novaclient.extension.Extension pickable.

Change-Id: Iec2321f7e2814a6ee09f4dd64ea630ddc714e30c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/31/287131/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _cached_extensions = {} def discover_extensions(version, only_contrib=False, cache=True): :param cache: Cache found extensions :type cache: bool if cache: key = "%s-%s" % (version, only_contrib) if key in _cached_extensions: return _cached_extensions[key] extensions = [ext.Extension(name, module) for name, module in chain] if cache: _cached_extensions[key] = extensions return extensions
deleted_lines: def discover_extensions(version, only_contrib=False): return [ext.Extension(name, module) for name, module in chain]

commit_message:
Add support of caching

It would be nice to cache some data. For example discovered extensions,
discovered version and etc.

expiration time is set to 5 minutes

Change-Id: I58ba6fce1e1ad2af976df40049c9f27c64e543a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/60/299860/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time import uuid from novaclient import api_versions from novaclient import cache from novaclient.tests.unit import utils from novaclient.v2 import client class CacheTestCase(utils.TestCase): def test_cache(self): namespace = str(uuid.uuid4()) return_data = str(uuid.uuid4()) self.called = False @cache.cache_on_arguments(expiration_time=0.5, namespace=namespace) def f(): if self.called: raise ValueError self.called = True return return_data self.assertEqual(return_data, f()) self.assertEqual(return_data, f()) time.sleep(0.5) self.assertRaises(ValueError, f) def test_to_str(self): url = "http://example.com" vers = api_versions.APIVersion("2.777") name = "NovaClient(endpoint=%s;api_version=%s)" % (url, vers.get_string()) cl = client.Client(api_version=vers, auth_url=url, direct_use=False) self.assertEqual(name, cache._to_str(cl))

commit_message:
Cache discover_version method

`discover_version` is called for every shell command. Lets reduce number of
calls to API and make shell quicker.

Change-Id: Ic354aba5bb7ce20362081e4e7f56eeb649b919cc

commit_message:
Default quota-show to current tenant and user

If no tenant or user is passed for "quota-show"
use the current tenant and user.
Removing the none test since it will not be relevant after this.

Change-Id: I49e73ca27b22aeaceb062a06561b1a030f1aa876
Closes-Bug: #1337990

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disk locally on the hypervisor;
A new boolean argument '--local-disks' for flavor-create is added.
If local-disks is set to False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.
All blockdevice mappings with dest_type local will be disallowed
with such flavors.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Add tenant_name when list nova usage

In openstack dashboard, when we click on admin -->overview,
It gives us overview of usage summary page. In that page,
we are able to see project name (i.e tenant name).

But in nova usage list command, we are getting tenant id not tenant name.
So the point is that along with tenant id, tenant name
should also be added as similar as in GUI page.

Closes-Bug: #1318770
Change-Id: Ibb556da5985f21aa1398cdb6fd69aaf03123b62c

commit_message:
WIP: add support for user specified service types

This allows image and network service types to be overwritten.

TODO: needs tests, though realistically this probably needs manual
testing on odd clouds.

Change-Id: I1e0b5c72bb7689a6c50181a2ea9ca907e882dfb8

commit_message:
flavor postional argument in nova boot help

The help for boot specifies flavor as a
optional parameter, where as running the
command without a flavor results in an
error. So corrected the help to include
flavor in the positional parameter list.

Change-Id: Ie98d340044a86049f6201b2980ad2c93518038dd
Closes-Bug: #1415319

[WIP] Init allocated ports set

Save allocated ports in set during creation
of LibvirtDriver to avoid redundant ports scanning.

commit_message:
not use cert and private key in glance client

nova connect to glance https server don't need cert
and private key file, a ca file should be enough

Change-Id: I85f7f71e5fa121e9d9524cf46e50d30959945026
Closes-Bug: 1612644

commit_message:
add test_obj_make_compatible for MonitorMetric

Currently the test case for obj_make_compatible() for MonitorMetric
object is missed. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I480dd15cf796689d7f4b6263959b851eacfd1b7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/277156/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_obj_make_compatible(self): obj = objects.MonitorMetric(name='cpu.frequency', value=1000, timestamp=_ts_now, source='nova.virt.libvirt.driver') primitive = obj.obj_to_primitive() obj.obj_make_compatible(primitive['nova_object.data'], '1.0') self.assertNotIn('numa_membw_values', primitive['nova_object.data'])

commit_message:
Implement state machine for live-migration.

This patch abstracts live migration state machine
from the old mixed migration status code.

Change-Id: I6dfce7f6811c01e44b6442191cadf36dc0ea7ce3
Partially-Implements: blueprint migration-state-machine
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/241476/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from automaton.machines import FiniteMachine from automaton.machines import Statefrom nova.objects import migration_status as Statusclass LiveMigrationStatusMachine(FiniteMachine): """Status machine of live migration. +-------------------------------+ | | | init | | | | | (CLAIM) | (START) | (FAIL) | +------- + -------+ | | | | | | V (QUEUE) V | +-- pre-migrating ------> queued -----+ | (ERROR) | | | | | (PREPARE) | | (FAIL) | +--------+--------+ | | (PREPARE) | | V V (FAIL) V error preparing ---------> failed ^ | (RUN) ^ | (ERROR) V | (FAIL) +-------------- running --------------+ | (END) V completed status: statuses of the state machine. (EVENT): events triggering the status changing. """ state_space = [ State(Status.INIT, False, {Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_START: Status.QUEUED, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_CLAIM: Status.PRE_MIGRATING}), State(Status.PRE_MIGRATING, False, {Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_QUEUE: Status.QUEUED, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_PREPARE: Status.PREPARING, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_ERROR: Status.ERROR, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.QUEUED, False, {Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_PREPARE: Status.PREPARING, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.PREPARING, False, {Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_RUN: Status.RUNNING, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.RUNNING, False, {Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_END: Status.COMPLETED, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_ERROR: Status.ERROR, Status.EVENT_LIVE_MIGRATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.COMPLETED, True, {}), State(Status.ERROR, True, {}), State(Status.FAILED, True, {}), ] def __init__(self): """Initialize the defaule start state to 'init'. All migration state machines start with 'init' by default. To change the start state, pass the start state to initialize(). NOTE: current_state will still be None until initialize() is called. """ super(LiveMigrationStatusMachine, self).__init__(Status.INIT)

commit_message:
Implement state machine for resize.

This patch abstracts resize state machine from
the old mixed migration status code.

Change-Id: I2901aae423e282842ad330c9e6f1dd829a67f0cc
Partially-Implements: blueprint migration-state-machine
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/241477/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ResizeStatusMachine(FiniteMachine): """Status machine of resize. init (START,CLAIM) | (CLAIM) | +--+ | | | (ERROR) V | V (FAIL) error <----------- pre-migrating -------------> failed ^ | (MIGRATE) | (ERROR) V +----------------- migrating | | (POST MIGRATE) | (ERROR) v +--------------- post-migrating | | (END) | (ERROR) v +------------------ finished | | +--------+ +--------+ (REVERT START) | | | | (CONFIRM START) v | | v reverting | | confirming (REVERT END) | | | | (CONFIRM END) v | | v reverted <--+ +--> confirmed status: statuses of the state machine. (EVENT): events triggering the status changing. """ state_space = [ State(Status.INIT, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_START: Status.PRE_MIGRATING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_CLAIM: Status.PRE_MIGRATING}), State(Status.PRE_MIGRATING, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_CLAIM: Status.PRE_MIGRATING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_MIGRATE: Status.MIGRATING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_ERROR: Status.ERROR, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.MIGRATING, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_POST_MIGRATE: Status.POST_MIGRATING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_ERROR: Status.ERROR}), State(Status.POST_MIGRATING, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_END: Status.FINISHED, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_ERROR: Status.ERROR}), State(Status.FINISHED, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_CONFIRM_START:Status.CONFIRMING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_CONFIRM_END:Status.CONFIRMED, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_REVERT_START:Status.REVERTING, Status.EVENT_RESIZE_REVERT_END:Status.REVERTED}), State(Status.CONFIRMING, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_CONFIRM_END:Status.CONFIRMED}), State(Status.REVERTING, False, {Status.EVENT_RESIZE_REVERT_END:Status.REVERTED}), State(Status.CONFIRMED, True, {}), State(Status.REVERTED, True, {}), State(Status.ERROR, True, {}), State(Status.FAILED, True, {}), ] def __init__(self): """Initialize the defaule start state to 'init'. All migration state machines start with 'init' by default. To change the start state, pass the start state to initialize(). NOTE: current_state will still be None until initialize() is called. """ super(ResizeStatusMachine, self).__init__(Status.INIT)

commit_message:
Implement state machine for evacuation.

This patch abstracts evacuation state machine from
the old mixed migration status code.

Change-Id: I48681fc4a8f86552bae4d9070c3292e19daf5ef7
Partially-Implements: blueprint migration-state-machine

added_lines: class EvacuationStatusMachine(FiniteMachine): """Status machine of Evacuation. init | (START) V +-------- accepted ----------+ | | (CLAIM) | (END) | V | (FAIL) | pre-migrating | | (END) | | (FAIL) | | V V | +------> done failed <------+ status: statuses of the state machine. (EVENT): events triggering the status changing. """ state_space = [ State(Status.INIT, False, {Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_START: Status.ACCEPTED}), State(Status.ACCEPTED, False, {Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_CLAIM: Status.PRE_MIGRATING, Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_END: Status.DONE, Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.PRE_MIGRATING, False, {Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_END: Status.DONE, Status.EVENT_EVACUATION_FAIL: Status.FAILED}), State(Status.DONE, True, {}), State(Status.FAILED, True, {}), ] def __init__(self): """Initialize the defaule start state to 'init'. All migration state machines start with 'init' by default. To change the start state, pass the start state to initialize(). NOTE: current_state will still be None until initialize() is called. """ super(EvacuationStatusMachine, self).__init__(Status.INIT)

commit_message:
test_db_api: optimize ArchiveTestCase

Avoid using of schema reflection when we don't really need it (we
already have this data in SQLAlchemy metadata produced from model
definitions). In other cases we can only reflect only the pieces we
need, like table table names instead of full tables metadata.

It's not crucial when tests are run against an in-memory SQLite DB,
but still allows to get a short cut in CPU time and memory usage
(5.8s vs 7.5s or ~22%, ~2 MB of RAM when running only these tests
with testtools).

Change-Id: If2e71577832552177b73db4b5930b8114a07aebc

added_lines: metadata = models.BASE.metadata tables = [ models.InstanceIdMapping.__table__, models.DNSDomain.__table__, models.Console.__table__, models.ConsolePool.__table__, models.Instance.__table__ ] for table in tables: orig = table.name shadow = 'shadow_' + orig try: shadow_table = metadata.tables[shadow] except KeyError: shadow_table = table.tometadata(metadata, name=shadow) setattr(self, orig, table) setattr(self, shadow, shadow_table) inspector = inspect(self.conn) for table in inspector.get_table_names(): if table.startswith("shadow_") and table not in exceptions: rows = self.conn.execute( "select count(*) from %s" % table).scalar() self.assertEqual(rows, 0, "Table %s not empty" % table) inspector = inspect(self.conn) table_names = inspector.get_table_names() for table_name in table_names: self.assertIn(table_name[7:], table_names) main_table = models.BASE.metadata.tables[tablename] try: shadow_table = models.BASE.metadata.tables["shadow_" + tablename] except KeyError: shadow_table = main_table.tometadata(models.BASE.metadata, name="shadow_" + tablename)
deleted_lines: self.instance_id_mappings = models.InstanceIdMapping.__table__ self.shadow_instance_id_mappings = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_instance_id_mappings") self.dns_domains = models.DNSDomain.__table__ self.shadow_dns_domains = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_dns_domains") self.consoles = models.Console.__table__ self.shadow_consoles = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_consoles") self.console_pools = models.ConsolePool.__table__ self.shadow_console_pools = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_console_pools") self.instances = models.Instance.__table__ self.shadow_instances = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_instances") metadata = MetaData(bind=self.engine) metadata.reflect() for table in metadata.tables: if table.startswith("shadow_") and table not in exceptions: rows = self.conn.execute("select * from %s" % table).fetchall() self.assertEqual(rows, [], "Table %s not empty" % table) metadata = MetaData(bind=self.engine) metadata.reflect() for table_name in metadata.tables: self.assertIn(table_name[7:], metadata.tables) main_table = sqlalchemyutils.get_table(self.engine, tablename) shadow_table = sqlalchemyutils.get_table( self.engine, "shadow_" + tablename)

subject: libvirt - Unrescue will not remove rescue disk when image_type=rbd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-25 18:55:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4d5b5d763a8254f276fc7ecb5c53afb455db456c', 'message': "libvirt - Unrescue will not remove rescue disk in ceph when image_type=rbd

This bug will happen when using libvirt/QEMU and image_type=rbd.

Rescue instance will produce rescue kernel and ramdisk disk in local.
It will also product rescue disk which will saved in ceph by rbd.
When users want to unrescue instance, nova will remove all rescue kernel
and ramdisk disk in local.
But rescue disk which was created in rescue step will still exist.

Because of unrescue action will remove local rescue file and lvm disk
but it didn't remove rdb disk. Therefore we need to add libvirt
images_type condition statement which will remove correct type of disk.

commit_message:
libvirt - Unrescue will not remove rescue disk when image_type=rbd

This bug happens when using libvirt/QEMU and image_type=rbd.

Rescue instance creates a rescue kernel and ramdisk disk in local.
It will also creates a rescue disk which will saved in ceph by rbd.
When users want to unrescue instance, nova will remove all rescue kernel
and ramdisk disk in local.
But rescue disk which was created in rescue step will still exist.

Because of unrescue action will remove local rescue file and lvm disk
but it didn't remove rbd disk. Therefore we need to add libvirt
images_type condition statement which will remove correct type of disk.

Change-Id: Id8693e5f1a63c400d0e90b2e4cd1251e64984ce8
Closes-Bug: 1478199
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/205766/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: driver.cleanup_volumes.assert_called_once_with(fake_instance, suffix=mock.ANY) def test_unrescue_with_lvm(self, mock_get_domain, mock_load_file, mock_get_instance_path): CONF.set_override('images_type', 'lvm', 'libvirt') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_utils, 'get_instance_path') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_utils, 'load_file') @mock.patch.object(host.Host, "get_domain") def test_unrescue_with_rbd(self, mock_get_domain, mock_load_file, mock_get_instance_path): CONF.set_override('images_type', 'rbd', 'libvirt') dummyxml = ("<domain type='kvm'><name>instance-0000000a</name>" "<devices>" "<disk type='block' device='disk'>" "<source dev='/dev/some-vg/some-lv'/>" "<target dev='vda' bus='virtio'/></disk>" "</devices></domain>") mock_get_instance_path.return_value = '/path' instance = objects.Instance(uuid='fake=uuid', id=1) fake_dom = FakeVirtDomain(fake_xml=dummyxml) mock_get_domain.return_value = fake_dom mock_load_file.return_value = "fake_unrescue_xml" unrescue_xml_path = os.path.join('/path', 'unrescue.xml') rescue_file = os.path.join('/path', 'rescue.file') drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) with contextlib.nested( mock.patch.object(drvr, '_destroy'), mock.patch.object(drvr, '_create_domain'), mock.patch.object(libvirt_utils, 'file_delete'), mock.patch.object(rbd_utils, 'RBDDriver'), mock.patch.object(glob, 'iglob', return_value=[rescue_file]) ) as (mock_destroy, mock_create, mock_del, mock_rbd, mock_glob): mock_rbd.return_value.cleanup_volumes = mock.Mock() drvr.unrescue(instance, None) mock_destroy.assert_called_once_with(instance) mock_create.assert_called_once_with("fake_unrescue_xml", fake_dom) self.assertEqual(2, mock_del.call_count) self.assertEqual(unrescue_xml_path, mock_del.call_args_list[0][0][0]) self.assertEqual(rescue_file, mock_del.call_args_list[1][0][0]) mock_rbd.return_value.cleanup_volumes.assert_called_once_with( instance, suffix='.rescue')

Use oslo.utils.reflection to get class names

utils' reflection module.

commit_message:
Improve character encoding in client messages

This patch improves handling of the character
encoding in client success and error messages.

As noted in the closed-bug, when the name of
something, (ie an instance), is unicode,
the client doesn't handle the success and error
messages well.

Change-Id: I22c83b489f1464714b385c47c043500e0b0c3e46
Closes-Bug: #1403379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/30/350230/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print( encodeutils.safe_encode(success_msg.__repr__()) % encodeutils.safe_encode(resource.__repr__()) ) print(encodeutils.safe_encode(unicode(e)))

commit_message:
Destroy dummy bdm when attaching volume

A dummy bdm record will be create if timeout
occurs during nova-api call nova-compute to
run reserve_block_device_name. The dummy bdm
record has a blank connection_info. The fix
will destroy the record.

Change-Id: I066e1e7b4726b87d24605866bf731803aae15feb
Closes-Bug: #1615908
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/358940/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # destroy dummy bdm entry try: bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping.get_by_volume_and_instance( context, volume_id, instance.uuid) except exception.VolumeBDMNotFound: bdm = None if bdm and bdm.connection_info is None: LOG.info(_LI("Found dummy BDM record for instance %(instance)s" " with volume %(vol_id)s on %(mountpoint)s. " "Destroy it."), {'instance': instance.uuid, 'vol_id': volume_id, 'mountpoint': bdm.device_name}) bdm.destroy()

The return value of objects.Quotas.count('server_group_members') was
not updated between the for-loop in _provision_instances() method,
but the number of server group members were growing, as a result,
the quota exceeded but we did not detect it.

In fact, Quotas.count() always returns 0 although InstanceGroup.add_members()
has been called many times. The reason may be that it does not update the
instance_group.members throughout the for-loop.

To fix this bug, we check server_group_members quota before the for-loop
instead of inside of it.

Change-Id: I03bec8ab9ababbc51861e54c5b8509f9d9fb923d
Closes-Bug: #1598859

commit_message:
server_group_members quota exceeded silently

The return value of objects.Quotas.count('server_group_members') was
not updated between the for-loop in _provision_instances() method,
but the number of server group members were growing, as a result,
the quota exceeded but we did not detect it.

In fact, Quotas.count() always returns 0 although InstanceGroup.add_members()
has been called many times. The reason may be that it does not update the
instance_group.members throughout the for-loop.

To fix this bug, we check server_group_members quota before the for-loop
instead of inside of it.

Change-Id: I03bec8ab9ababbc51861e54c5b8509f9d9fb923d
Closes-Bug: #1598859
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/337251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance_group and check_server_group_quota: count = objects.Quotas.count(context, 'server_group_members', instance_group, context.user_id) count += num_instances try: objects.Quotas.limit_check(context, server_group_members=count) except exception.OverQuota: msg = _("Quota exceeded, too many servers in group") raise exception.QuotaError(msg)
deleted_lines: if check_server_group_quota: count = objects.Quotas.count(context, 'server_group_members', instance_group, context.user_id) try: objects.Quotas.limit_check(context, server_group_members=count + 1) except exception.OverQuota: msg = _("Quota exceeded, too many servers in " "group") raise exception.QuotaError(msg)

subject: Add option to disable local disks in flavors [3/3]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 11:39:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a0340e3444e183286b45510da9ea860b0d4a0f27', 'message': 'Add option to disable local disks in flavors [3/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the REST API related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I2533db3b08ddc66f42348135dcc2decfb5c3e861

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors [3/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the REST API related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I2533db3b08ddc66f42348135dcc2decfb5c3e861
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock class

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should be
replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes should
be set on it.

Change-Id: I9cb81acddb54909dbcd6d65547dbd9408069f289
Closes-Bug: #1475722

commit_message:
live-migration: Update instance availability_zone

This uses availability_zones package to find instance's az info
and update database record in post_live_migration_at_destination.

Change-Id: I0884c9172c761e876373726b741ba923d36d675b
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>

added_lines: from nova import availability_zones as az def _get_compute_zone(self, context, host): return az.get_host_availability_zone(context, host) instance.availability_zone = self._get_compute_zone( context, self.host)

commit_message:
XenAPI: add unit test for the plugin - glance

Add unit test for the xenapi plugin -glance and also add
a boolean return value to _download_tarball_and_verify
so that it's eaiser to check the result for this function.

Change-Id: Ib1a8bd455b972798f2988834de61cfce048c15f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/299533/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock try: import httplib except ImportError: from six.moves import http_client as httplib import sys import urllib2 from nova.tests.unit.virt.xenapi.plugins import plugin_test class GlanceTestCase(plugin_test.PluginTestBase): def setUp(self): super(GlanceTestCase, self).setUp() # md5 is deprecated in py2.7 and forward; sys.modules['md5'] = mock.Mock() self.glance = self.load_plugin("glance") @mock.patch.object(urllib2.Request, 'get_full_url', return_value='fake_url') @mock.patch.object(urllib2, 'urlopen') def test_download_tarball_and_verify(self, mock_urlopen, mock_get_full_url): mock_extract_tarball = self.mock_patch_object( self.glance.utils, 'extract_tarball') mock_info = mock.MagicMock() mock_info.getheader.return_value = 'expect_cksum' mock_urlopen.return_value.info.return_value = mock_info fake_request = urllib2.Request('http://fakeurl.com') def _test_download_and_verify_ok(): self.glance.md5.new.return_value.hexdigest.return_value = \ 'expect_cksum' result = self.glance._download_tarball_and_verify( fake_request, 'fake_staging_path') self.glance._download_tarball_and_verify, fake_request, 'fake_staging_path') _test_download_and_verify_ok() _test_download_ok_verify_failed() _test_download_failed_HTTPError() commit_message:
StandardError raises NameError in Python3

StandardError is not defined in Python3, it will raise  NameError in
code. This patch is to fix this bug.

Change-Id: Ic8578a5ad719b94e6216bd7adbd00613d0ece078
Closes-Bug: #1595830

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock class

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should be
replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes should
be set on it.

Change-Id: I89a79400b8462c3996a84c4195034db515be1162
Closes-Bug: #1475722

commit_message:
Instance can not resize ephemeral disk

I boot an instance with an ephemeral disk, the ephemeral
is named disk.eph0. Then resize the instance, but
ephemeral disk.eph0 is not resized.

The reason is that when instance has only a ephemeral disk,
the ephemeral disk file named disk.eph0, but when resize
instance, it judgment the ephemeral disk named disk.local.
Therefore, a ephemeral disk can not be resized.

This patch update code, if only one ephemeral disk is
specified, name it as disk.local, else name them
as disk.eph0, disk.eph1, etc ...

Change-Id: Iad30e296c2b47d12fef7c65df20d96791e9bbb13
Closes-Bug: #1558880

commit_message:
[WIP]: Add test case for delete dangling ports on timeout.

Adding a test scenario for deleting dangling ports on timeout or
failure. When launching many instances in parallel, Nova sees timeouts
from Neutron and fails to clean the ports.

This commit includes test scenario for deleting ports. Functionality
change is addressed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347183/

Change-Id: Ibede2e3e04e302c414ffbde5c8f18627dc9bbb76
Depends-On: #347183
Partial-Bug: #1603909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/374965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random def test_delete_dangling_ports(self): api = neutronapi.API() networks = [objects.NetworkRequest(network_id=uuids.net)] port_security_nets = {uuids.net: {"id": uuids.net, "port_security_enabled": True}} nets = {uuids.net: {"id": uuids.net, "port_security_enabled": False}} random_count = random.sample([x for x in range(100)], 20) mock_client = mock.Mock() with test.nested( mock.patch.object(neutronapi, 'get_client', return_value=mock_client), mock.patch.object(api, '_delete_ports') ) as ( mock_get_client, mock_delete_ports ): for x in range(100): instance = objects.Instance(uuid=str(uuid.uuid4()), project_id=uuids.tenant_id, hostname="host") port_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) mock_client.create_port.return_value = {"port": {"id": port_id}} if x in random_count: mock_client.list_ports.return_value = {'ports': [{'id': port_id}]} self.assertRaises(exception.SecurityGroupCannotBeApplied, api._create_ports_for_instance, self.context, instance, networks, port_security_nets, mock_client, None) mock_delete_ports.assert_called_with(mock_client, instance, [port_id]) else: api._create_ports_for_instance(self.context, instance, networks, nets, mock_client, None)

commit_message:
policy: verifying forced_host's target should have context.project_id

"create:forced_host" action is enabled for the "admin_or_owner" role
by default, so here we should add the context.project_id as the target role,
rather than empty.

Change-Id: Id148938f2bc35b90531d4adec237c8ced9b7dc8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/347673/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'create:forced_host')

commit_message:
Move extra_specs_ops to oslo.utils

Ironic needs to do some capability matching that has feature parity with
Nova's capability matching. Rather than trying to re-create it
ourselves, we've moved Nova's matching code into oslo.utils so that we
make sure it's always the same.

Change the nova code to use the code from the library.

Change-Id: Ia54f97ebc52a8099ced5b77796dbb2f0f0c63266
Depends-On: I2dabb5301f8270b4431572e4689665dc739f72ea

commit_message:
libvirt: Optimize _get_instance_disk_info

In some cases, len(disk_nodes) is not equal to len(path_nodes). I fix
this problem.

Change-Id: Iddac5519761ee2ea99c3622f969edf6223ce11bc

added_lines: @mock.patch("os.path.getsize") def test_get_instance_disk_info_disk_file_is_empty(self, mock_getsize): instance = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) dummyxml = ("<domain type='kvm'><name>instance-0000000a</name>" "<devices>" "<disk type='file' device='cdrom'>" "<driver name='qemu' type='raw' cache='none'/>" "<target dev='hda' bus='ide'/></disk>" "<disk type='block' device='disk'>" "<driver name='qemu' type='qcow2' cache='none'/>" "<source dev='/dev/mapper/mpathp'/>" "<target dev='vda' bus='virtio'/></disk>" "</devices></domain>") block_device_info = \ {'block_device_mapping': [{'guest_format': None, 'boot_index': 0, 'mount_device': u'/dev/vda', 'connection_info': {u'driver_volume_type': u'iscsi'}, 'disk_bus': u'virtio', 'device_type': u'disk', 'delete_on_termination': False}], 'swap': None, 'ephemerals': [], 'root_device_name': u'/dev/vda'} domain_mock = mock.Mock() domain_mock.XMLDesc = mock.Mock() domain_mock.XMLDesc.return_value = dummyxml def fake_lookup(instance_name): if instance_name == instance.name: return domain_mock self.create_fake_libvirt_mock(lookupByName=fake_lookup) mock_getsize.return_value = 1000 drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) info = drvr.get_instance_disk_info(instance, block_device_info=block_device_info) info = jsonutils.loads(info) self.assertEqual([], info)

commit_message:
VMware - Favor shared datastores

When choosing the datastore, prefer the one with more connected hosts.
Also make sure that the choosen datastore has enough free space to hold
the image.

Fixes-Bug: #1216209
Co-author: Radoslav Gerganov
Change-Id: Ic974b92fff7ff48f12c734aed62ee4eba6cbdd41

commit_message:
libvirt/driver: armv7/aarch64 vga, serial defaults

Nova libvirt driver hardcodes default options for both video=cirrus
and serial console.

armv7 and aarch64 VMs require video=vga, and since most applications
use PL011 serial driver for guests, adding console=ttyAMA0 is also
a nice UX addition.

Change-Id: Ibb136def0ca624d192865256edcfb1131173cfdc
Signed-off-by: Stanislaw Kardach <stanislaw.kardach@caviumnetworks.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexandru Avadanii <Alexandru.Avadanii@enea.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/330124/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: guestarch = libvirt_utils.get_arch(image_meta) if guestarch in (arch.ARMV7, arch.AARCH64): # NOTE(armband): ARM v7/v8 use PL011 drv, add ttyAMA0 console guest.os_cmdline += " console=ttyAMA0" elif guestarch in (arch.ARMV7, arch.AARCH64, arch.PPC, arch.PPC64, arch.PPC64LE): # NOTE(armband): Added ARM v7/v8, same as on PPC.

If this value is not 0, nova compute will check whether the server is in ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` state longer than value of resize_confirm_window, in which case it will automatically confirm the resize of the server. available to be used by other servers. Otherwise, the resource will be kept for the duration of ``shelved_offload_time`` (in seconds) so that during this time period the unshelve action will be faster, before the periodic task removes the server from hypervisor. Set the ``shelved_offload_time`` option to -1 in order to prevent it ever being offloaded. Shelve will power off the given server and take a snapshot if it was booted from an image. The server can then be offloaded from the compute host and its again, on a newly scheduled host if it was offloaded, using the shelved image in the glance repository if the server was originally booted from image. Lock a server so that no further actions are allowed to be performed on the server. This can be done by either the administrator or the server's owner. By default, only the owner or administrator can lock the sever, and the administrator can overwrite the owner's lock. Unlock will unlock a server in locked state so that additional operations can be performed on the server. By default, only the owner or the administrator can unlock the server. Set the root/administrator password for the given server. This action uses an optional installed agent to inject the administrator password. another host; it utilizes the 'resize' action but with same flavor, so that during the migration, the server will be powered off and rebuilt on another host. Live migrate also moves a server from one host to another, but it won't power off the server, so that the server will not suffer any downtime. Administrators may use this to move all running servers from a host that needs to undergo maintenance tasks. The destination host on which the migrated server is placed may either be determined in the usual way by the nova scheduler service, or else explicitly specified by the administrator.- The maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded datagroup as the owner and group, respectively, and allow user and group read access only (octal 440). In order to prepare the host for decommissioning, it first needs to be disabled so it does not receive any newly scheduled servers. Then each server should be migrated to a new host by cold or live migration, depending on the state of the server. When complete, the host is free to be removed. that has not yet been updated is disabled and all its active servers are migrated to the new host. When the migrations are complete, the new host continues normal operation. The old host will no longer have any active servers so can be updated and rebooted. It then becomes the new target for another round of migrations. usually using a pool of initially empty hosts instead of just one. - **Resource Optimization** To reduce energy usage, some cloud operators will try to movebe lost. In this case the operator may rebuild the servers on thehosts without concern that the old incarnations reappear and try to.. note:: This operation can result in data loss for the user's server. As there is no access to the original server, if there were any disks stored on local storage, that data will be lost. Evacuate does the same operation as a rebuild. It downloads any images from glance and creates new blank ephemeral disks. Any disks that were volumes, or on shared storage, are reconnected. There should be no data loss for those disks. This is why fencing the host is important, to ensure volumes and shared storage are not corrupted by two servers writing simultaneously.User resizes server to scale up or down ---------------------------------------Resizing a server is not normally initiated by the cloud operator because it changes the nature of the server being provided to the user.Shelving a server is not normally initiated the cloud operator because it affects the availability of the server being provided to the user.that cloud-aware applications running on the server can access.metadata service to allow the server access to its metadata through a predefined ip address (169.254.169.254). Add database tables to CellsV2 database split docs

The current documentation for the CellsV2 database split is missing
some tables. This adds missing tables in the design documentation.
